Title: Data Analyst/ Business Operation Junior
Description:
Randstad Technologies, divisione specializzata nella ricerca selezione di profili ICT di Randstad Italia, ricerca per società fondata da un primario fondo di investimento infrastrutturale italiano con l’obiettivo di diventare il primo operatore indipendente in Italia nello sviluppo e nella gestione di infrastrutture di ricarica ad alta potenza per veicoli elettrici un




Data Analyst/Business Operation Specialist Junior




La risorsa sarà inserita all’interno del dipartimento IT e sarà responsabile della gestione della Data Platform e supporterà le operazioni quotidiane dell'azienda.




Nello specifico, si occuperà di:

Gestire la Data Platform, verificando la qualità dei dati e apportando modifiche a report e dashboard
Gestire il processo di settlement delle bollette di energia elettrica (verificando eventuali incongruenze tramite analisi dati)
Supportare i processi verso i clienti finali
Coordinare le attività di troubleshooting con altri dipartimenti interni e fornitori esterni
Analizzare e migliorare i processi aziendali esistenti per ottimizzare l'efficienza operativa







Sono richiesti i seguenti requisiti:

diploma e/o Laurea in ambito tecnico e percorso di studi in ambito Analisi dati
conoscenza e utilizzo di strumenti di analisi dati (Microsoft Excel e Power BI) e SQL
gradita esperienza pregressa nel ruolo di Data Analyst
capacità analitiche e di problem solving
attenzione ai dettagli e capacità di gestire più progetti contemporaneamente
gradito interesse per il settore Energy




Si offre inserimento diretto con l’azienda a tempo indeterminato e RAL commisurata all’esperienza.




Sede di lavoro: Milano (Zona Linate) con possibilità di smart working.




La ricerca è rivolta ai candidati ambosessi (l.903/77). Ti preghiamo di leggere l'informativa sulla privacy ai sensi dell'art. 13 del regolamento (ue) 2016/679 sulla protezione dei dati (gdpr).

Show more
HTML:
Randstad Technologies, divisione specializzata nella ricerca selezione di profili ICT di Randstad Italia, ricerca per società fondata da un primario fondo di investimento infrastrutturale italiano con l’obiettivo di diventare il primo operatore indipendente in Italia nello sviluppo e nella gestione di infrastrutture di ricarica ad alta potenza per veicoli elettrici un


Data Analyst/Business Operation Specialist Junior


La risorsa sarà inserita all’interno del dipartimento IT e sarà responsabile della gestione della Data Platform e supporterà le operazioni quotidiane dell'azienda.


Nello specifico, si occuperà di:

  • Gestire la Data Platform, verificando la qualità dei dati e apportando modifiche a report e dashboard
  • Gestire il processo di settlement delle bollette di energia elettrica (verificando eventuali incongruenze tramite analisi dati)
  • Supportare i processi verso i clienti finali
  • Coordinare le attività di troubleshooting con altri dipartimenti interni e fornitori esterni
  • Analizzare e migliorare i processi aziendali esistenti per ottimizzare l'efficienza operativa



Sono richiesti i seguenti requisiti:

  • diploma e/o Laurea in ambito tecnico e percorso di studi in ambito Analisi dati
  • conoscenza e utilizzo di strumenti di analisi dati (Microsoft Excel e Power BI) e SQL
  • gradita esperienza pregressa nel ruolo di Data Analyst
  • capacità analitiche e di problem solving
  • attenzione ai dettagli e capacità di gestire più progetti contemporaneamente
  • gradito interesse per il settore Energy


Si offre inserimento diretto con l’azienda a tempo indeterminato e RAL commisurata all’esperienza.


Sede di lavoro: Milano (Zona Linate) con possibilità di smart working.


La ricerca è rivolta ai candidati ambosessi (l.903/77). Ti preghiamo di leggere l'informativa sulla privacy ai sensi dell'art. 13 del regolamento (ue) 2016/679 sulla protezione dei dati (gdpr).

Title: Junior Data Analyst (Insurance)
HTML:
Mavriq, divisione B2C di Moltiply Group, è la tech company a cui appartengono alcuni tra i più importanti brand di comparazione ed intermediazione online in Italia (MutuiOnline.it, Segugio.it, SOStariffe.it, Trovaprezzi.it e molti altri) e all’estero (LeLynx.fr, Rastreator.com e Rastreator.mx). I servizi offerti dai brand di Mavriq aiutano con trasparenza i consumatori a trovare ciò di cui hanno bisogno, al miglior prezzo. Mavriq conta oggi più di 800 persone distribuite in Europa, America Latina ed Asia.


Posizione

Il nostro team Insurance è alla ricerca di un/una brillante neolaureato per la posizione di Junior Data Analyst.

Come Junior Data Analyst avrai il compito di supportare il team nella definizione e realizzazione di progetti strategici con l'obiettivo di garantire il miglior livello di servizio per rispondere alla crescente domanda dei nostri Clienti. Ti occuperai della creazione di modelli quantitativi e dashboard a supporto dello sviluppo di Segugio.it e del miglioramento delle performance dei processi di business, affiancandoti a data analyst esperti ed acquisendo una profonda conoscenza del business assicurativo e dell’online.


Più nel dettaglio:

  • Svilupperai ed implementerai modelli quantitativi e dashboard;
  • Supporterai la direzione Insurance nell’ottimizzazione dei processi esistenti e nello sviluppo di nuove attività/processi/linee di business;
  • Lavorerai in sinergia con le diverse funzioni aziendali per sviluppare, testare ed ottimizzare i processi.
  • Requisiti
  • Neolaureato STEM o statistica;
  • Ottime capacità analitiche e propensione all'implementazione di modelli matematici e predittivi;
  • Precisione e attenzione nell'esecuzione delle attività;
  • Conoscenza avanzata di Microsoft Excel;
  • Proattività, predisposizione al lavoro in team;
  • Conoscenza di R o Python, Tableau e SQL verranno considerati un plus.


Cosa troverai da noi

  • Un ambiente di lavoro giovane e stimolante;
  • Colleghi altrettanto appassionati con cui confrontarti e imparare (e anche a cui insegnare qualcosa di nuovo);
  • Possibilità di contribuire attivamente ai successi dell'azienda e di veder riconosciuti i tuoi meriti indipendentemente dalla tua seniority;
  • Flessibilità, smart working e welfare;
  • Incontri periodici di feedback che ti permetteranno di accrescere la tua professionalità e migliorare le tue performance;
  • Momenti di aggregazione, condivisione e celebrazione dei successi;
  • Iniziative volte alla formazione ed allo scambio di competenze;
  • Possibilità di lavorare con un team d’eccellenza in ambito assicurativo diretto.


Se credi che questa sia l'azienda giusta per te, mandaci il tuo CV!


Sede di lavoro: Milano, via Desenzano 2 (MM Gambara)



La ricerca è rivolta ad ambo i sessi (ai sensi delle Leggi n. 903/77 e n. 125/91).


Si richiede esplicito consenso al trattamento dei dati personali (ex D.Lgs. 196/03 e GDPR - Reg.UE. 2016/679).

Title: Data Analyst - Field Marketing
Description:
Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?

Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.

Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!




Ti offriamo di diventare

il guru dei nostri dati.




Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.

Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile.

Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.




Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?




Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti.




Come?

> realizzando report su misura;

> utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);

> sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;

> collaborando con i colleghi del team.




Sei tu la persona giusta?




Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.




In più è fantastico se…

> ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;

> excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;

> hai una conoscenza base di SQL e PowerBI

> ti entusiasma lavorare in team;

> sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!




Altre informazioni

Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.

Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

Title: Data Analyst, Internship
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.




To achieve this mission, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.




For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.




A few examples of your responsibilities

Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.




What we look for

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.




What we offer

Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of €52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.




Commitment & contract

Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.




Location

Milan (Italy) or fully remote.




Before you apply

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don’t hesitate to apply.




The selection process

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.




Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.




Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Title: Data Analyst Intern (m/f/d)
Description:
About us




BayWa r.e. Italia Srl is the Italian holding of the German multinational company BayWa r.e. We are a growth driven, global company and offer exciting opportunities at every career level with great development potential. We are active worldwide in the wind, solar and bioenergy sectors. For our customers, we are a valued and reliable partner with a diverse range of services.




About the role




For our company Energy Trading in Milan (MI), we are looking for a Data Analyst Intern (m/f/d)




What you will do




Plants and meteo data collection from SCADA systems and/or data logger of various PV plants and related quantitative analysis on power default and outages of PV plants. This task will focus on another source of uncertainty in the predicted production of PV systems: unplanned outage of components due to failure or deviations from their operating range (e.g., inverters getting too hot).
To tackle this problem, a statistical analysis on historical outage data will be conducted to identify patterns and correlations with energy trading activities. By understanding the link between outage duration and its potential impact on energy trading contracts, operators can implement risk management strategies and contingency plans. This will include analyzing the trade-offs with the self-consumption by the ancillary systems of the plant (e.g., cooling systems). Moreover, the task will yield indications on possible investment in equipment and maintenance practices to reduce the occurrence of power outages, ensuring smoother energy trading operations.
Develop probabilistic forecast at primary substation level to predict possible overgeneration that might cause congestion based on the data provided by the partners or publicly available data: starting from production forecast model of PV plants (provided) the aim of this task is to develop a forecasting service to predict grid congestion. Three levels of precision can be explored: (i) purely data driven forecasting of events, based on historical, publicly available information on congestion and redispatch events (ii) construction of graphs based on the physical topology of the power network and training based on historical data, and (iii) physics-informed machine learning to predict power flows and issues on lines and substations.
Trading strategies for value stacking: define and test trading approaches at the plant level, assuming that high-resolution probabilistic forecasts and some flexibility on the customer’s side are available considering the electrification of the energy system in the future scenarios. Different trading approaches will be tested. Eventually, based on the energy price signals from the ancillary services market, a techno-economic strategy based on probabilistic PV forecasting will be developed, to make PV-battery systems profitable to participate in both the ancillary services and day-ahead markets, rather than in the day-ahead market only.




What you will need to succeed




MS in engineering or other quantitative subjects
Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken
Good knowledge of quantitative analysis Coding capabilities




Soft skills

Ability to translate analysis into practical and implementable recommendations
Highly analytical thinker with a structured logical and pragmatic approach to problem solving




What We Are Ready To Offer You




Smart working
International team (86 different nationalities working for BayWa r.e. across the globe)
Flat hierarchies, an open culture and plenty of leeway for your ideas
Modern office ambience (height-adjustable desks, additional monitors, ergonomic chairs, etc.)




Location: Milan

Term of contract: stage 6/12 months




You matter to us




At BayWa r.e. we are fully committed to fostering equity and inclusion and embrace the diversity, of all our people, both present and those yet to join us! We welcome applications from everyone, irrespective of gender, gender identity, national origin, religion, social-, cultural-, or ethnic-background, sex, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other status protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. We are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer for all by providing an inclusive environment free of discrimination or harassment.




If you as an applicant require additional assistance or accommodation throughout the recruitment process, please reach out to us.




Candidates of both sexes (Law 903/77) can send their CV giving authorization to personal data processing according to Legislative Decree 196/03

Title: Data Warehouse Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

La funzione ICT sviluppa e gestisce le applicazioni software e l'infrastruttura tecnologica della Banca. Promuove la razionalizzazione in azienda di tutti i processi di lavoro, a supporto delle linee di business, tramite la rilevazione delle esigenze di servizi informatici e promozione delle opportunità tecnologiche offerte dall'evoluzione del sistema informativo.

Descrizione dell'attività

Inserita all'interno dell'area Data Warehouse, la persona da noi ricercata sarà chiamata a svolgere le seguenti attività:


Analizzare le esigenze degli utenti interni in termini di reporting e analisi.
Esplicitare i fabbisogni informativi.
Disegnare e implementare le procedure di integrazione dati dai sistemi alimentanti.
Definire e implementare i reports e le analisi sui dati.



Requirements


Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o Statistica/Matematica.
Interesse verso le tematiche di modellazione dati, sviluppo e gestione database, business intelligence.
Conoscenza di almeno un database fra MS SQL Server, MS Access, Oracle, Sybase, MySQL.



Costituiscono Titolo Preferenziale


Esperienza con Analysis Services (SSAS).
Conoscenza di un qualche tool di business intelligence (per esempio PowerBI).



Si desidera entrare in contatto con persone che si distinguono per le ottime capacità relazionali, affidabilità ed autonomia organizzativa.

Completano il profilo una forte determinazione ed orientamento al risultato, una personalità vivace e proattiva, con ottime capacità organizzative e doti di riservatezza e affidabilità.

Other information

Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Tipo di contratto: CCNL credito, tempo indeterminato

Il Gruppo Fineco è orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversità, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro. Fineco “The Place To Be”
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

La funzione ICT sviluppa e gestisce le applicazioni software e l'infrastruttura tecnologica della Banca. Promuove la razionalizzazione in azienda di tutti i processi di lavoro, a supporto delle linee di business, tramite la rilevazione delle esigenze di servizi informatici e promozione delle opportunità tecnologiche offerte dall'evoluzione del sistema informativo.

Descrizione dell'attività

Inserita all'interno dell'area Data Warehouse, la persona da noi ricercata sarà chiamata a svolgere le seguenti attività:

  • Analizzare le esigenze degli utenti interni in termini di reporting e analisi.
  • Esplicitare i fabbisogni informativi.
  • Disegnare e implementare le procedure di integrazione dati dai sistemi alimentanti.
  • Definire e implementare i reports e le analisi sui dati.


Requirements

  • Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o Statistica/Matematica.
  • Interesse verso le tematiche di modellazione dati, sviluppo e gestione database, business intelligence.
  • Conoscenza di almeno un database fra MS SQL Server, MS Access, Oracle, Sybase, MySQL.


Costituiscono Titolo Preferenziale

  • Esperienza con Analysis Services (SSAS).
  • Conoscenza di un qualche tool di business intelligence (per esempio PowerBI).


Si desidera entrare in contatto con persone che si distinguono per le ottime capacità relazionali, affidabilità ed autonomia organizzativa.

Completano il profilo una forte determinazione ed orientamento al risultato, una personalità vivace e proattiva, con ottime capacità organizzative e doti di riservatezza e affidabilità.

Other information

Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Tipo di contratto: CCNL credito, tempo indeterminato

Il Gruppo Fineco è orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversità, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro. Fineco “The Place To Be”

Title: Supply Data Analyst - Internship
Description:
Ogury is a global adtech company that delivers Personified Advertising solutions grounded in privacy to brands, agencies and publishers by focusing on targeting personas, not people.

We deliver relevant audiences at scale and on quality publisher inventory thanks to our exclusive data, which is meticulously collected and crafted from millions of self-declared customer surveys, enriched with billions of impactful data points, and refined by AI. This results in audience insights and performance not available through any other AdTech platform.

Founded in 2014, Ogury is a global organization with a diverse team of 500+ people across 17 countries.

At Ogury, our vision unites us all. But we know that it takes people from all walks of life to come together and make it happen. We embrace and celebrate what makes us different, creating a unique and winning culture where everyone feels safe, has access to the same opportunities, and is excited about bringing their most authentic self to work. Everyday.

Together we’re changing the face of adtech with values that inspire excellence, standards that encourage a leadership mindset, and an inclusive workplace where Ogurians are engaged and know they belong.

About The Role

Ogury is seeking a highly motivated Supply Data Analyst Intern to help our efforts towards data analysis. The intern will assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support our business decisions and strategic initiatives. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis and work within a dynamic and innovative tech environment.

What You Will Do


Data Collection and Cleaning: Assist in gathering data from multiple sources, including internal databases, spreadsheets, and third-party data systems. Perform data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Help maintain data quality and support data management activities.
Data Analysis: Conduct basic statistical analyses and generate reports to identify trends and patterns. Support senior analysts with more complex data analysis tasks. Utilize tools such as Excel, SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Reporting and Visualization: Create data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Metabase as the main tool. Present analytical findings to team members and stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Support and Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Assist in developing and implementing data collection systems and strategies to optimize data efficiency and quality.
Learning and Development: Stay current with industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance analytical skills and knowledge.


About You


Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel; knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools such as Metabase is a plus.
Basic understanding of statistical methods and data analysis techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with programming languages such as Python.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and tools.
Experience with big data tools and technologies.


Show more

Title: Senior BI Data Analyst (Tableau)
HTML:
Randstad Digital è una società di consulenza globale nei settori Information technologies e Engineering, con oltre 25.000 esperti in tutto il mondo. Siamo un'organizzazione che mette al primo posto i talenti, e siamo focalizzati nell’abilitare i nostri clienti nei loro percorsi di trasformazione digitale e nello sviluppare importanti progetti di contenuto tecnologico.


Sei pronto per la tua prossima sfida?



Per rafforzare il nostro team, all’interno del contesto italiano in forte fase di scale-up, per l'offerta di servizi professionali in ambito IT, siamo alla ricerca di un/una:


Senior BI Data Analyst


La risorsa dovrà occuparsi delle seguenti attività:


  • Sviluppo e mantenimento di dashboard e report di Business Intelligence (Tableau);
  • Estrazione, elaborazione e caricamento dati;
  • Risoluzione problematiche relative ai dati e gestione dell'infrastruttura di Business Intelligence;
  • Documentazione tecnica.


Requisiti:


  • Esperienza nel ruolo di Analista in ambito BI;
  • Capacità di elaborazione dati;
  • Ottima conoscenza di Tableau;
  • Conoscenza di SQL;
  • Buona capacità di problem solving;
  • Capacità di lavorare in team.



Sede di lavoro: Milano- Modalità ibrida.


La ricerca è rivolta ai candidati ambosessi (L.903/77). Ti preghiamo di leggere l'informativa sulla privacy ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679 sulla protezione dei dati (GDPR).

Title: BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE SPECIALIST
Description:
The candidate will work in the R&D Product Factory, as part of the Business Intelligence & AI team with other experts in the field and will report to the BI & Data Science Lead.




The main activities required to the selected candidate aims at consolidating and widening the general knowledge and technological knowhow of RGI in the field of the Business Intelligence.




Responsibilities:

Implement reports and dashboards leveraging best in class business intelligence tool (e.g. Qlik Sense)
Conduct analysis on insurance business topics: interview with client, formalization of business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports and dashboards
Design & build management information dashboards to monitor internal processes and answer business questions about trends, opportunities, and data quality issues
Became responsible of specific project stream, ensuring a high level of data quality for core data sources and relevant KPIs
Research tools, frameworks and mechanisms for data analytics providing input to new technology opportunities that will have an impact on the company BI systems
Collaborate with Data Scientists in the RGI R&D Innovation Department, contributing in the development of new algorithms and models, providing application with vertical focus on the Insurance Industry




Experiences: 1-3 years’ experience in a Business intelligence and Analytics position.




Technical competences:

Previous experience with the business intelligence tool Qlik Sense/Qlik View
Proficiency in database query construction and data mining (SQL, PL/SQL)
Experience in ETL tools (e.g. Talend, IBM DataStage, Business Objects, Alteryx, etc.) and management of databases is a strong plus
Knowledge with one of the following languages: Python, R, MATLAB, SAS is a plus
Knowledge of big data architecture and data manipulation tools, based on Cloudera and HortonWorks (e.g. Apache Spark, Elasticsearch, Kafka….) is a plus
Proven capability to quickly grasp new processes and technologies
Fluent in Italian
Professional English Knowledge




Personal skills:

Attitude at team-working
Commitment, precision, autonomy
Willingness of learning and delivering innovation-based products to a wider audience
Attention to detail, passion for processes, systems and data mining




Education: The candidate will have a Master’s Degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or a related quantitative discipline.







This announcement is addressed to candidates of both sexes pursuant to the law (L.903 / 77 and Legislative Decree No. 98/2006, art. 27). The interested party is invited to send his / her application by giving specific consent to the processing of personal data, pursuant to the new European Privacy Law, in accordance with articles 13 and 14 of the GDPR (Regulation (EU), 27 April 2016, n. 2016/679).

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Data Quality Analyst (fixed-term contract)

sennder is Europe’s leading digital freight forwarder. In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitize and automate all road logistics processes. We are a growing team looking for a Data Quality Analyst to help us on our journey to revolutionise road freight logistics. You would join our “Operations Program & Innovation” department, based out of the Milan office and will report to the Team Lead Ops. Quality.

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

What You Will Do …

As a Data Quality Analyst you’ll work on interesting responsibilities like supporting the Operations Programs & Innovation department and specifically the Network Quality Team by analyzing and identifying logistic network inefficiencies, managing carriers delays and penalties.


Ensure compliance with service quality KPIs by monitoring and supporting continuous performance improvement.
Work together with carriers to reduce the impact of low performances through bonus/malus mechanisms.
Analyze operational issues by identifying their root causes and proposing corrective actions through daily KPIs monitoring (e.g., on-time performance, incidents).
Build supplier performance reports in order to create presentations useful to management.
Support the definition of processes with the aim of identifying best practices and improving performance.
Work closely with Operations and Program Management teams to improve our quality metrics.
Develop and maintain relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.


What We Are Looking For …


Bachelor's degree in economics, statistics, engineering, or equivalent work experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Italian and English.
Proficiency in G-Suite and MS Office (Excel & PowerPoint); essential proficiency in SQL.
Strong analytical skills to conduct analyses and translate them into actionable insights.
Proactive, self-starter with excellent organizational skills.
Strong interpersonal skills and adaptive mindset with the ability to learn quickly.
Strong team player with a collaborative attitude.


ABOUT Sennder Italia

sennder Italia, based in the heart of Milan, is a joint venture company between sennder and Poste Italiane. Our company matches the digital and innovative focus on technologies and digitalization of sennder with the expertise and know-how of the largest distribution network in Italy, Poste Italiane.

We not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we’re growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe’s inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Read more about the sennder Italia joint venture here.

What You Can Expect

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual potential of all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit and respect to build fruitful collaboration across teams. Learn more about who we are on our career site.


Fast growth scale-up with an international team of 1000 people, 74+ nationalities spread across 11 European offices. With English as our common language, we are able to work together.
Learning and development on the job and with the support of a bi-annual review process, learning allowance, high potential programs, sennder onboarding academy, and internal trainings.
Various opportunities to connect with colleagues through regular team events and company get-togethers such as our highly anticipated sennder Summer Camp.
Prioritize employee engagement and mental well-being by fostering a supportive environment through the Likeminded platform and conducting regular employee satisfaction surveys.
Hybrid work model where you seamlessly merge virtual productivity and in-office collaboration with your colleagues.
Commuter allowance to assist employees with their daily travel expenses and a one-time home office benefit to ensure that you're properly equipped wherever you work.
Competitive compensation package including objective-based bonus, referral reward, and in some cases virtual option plan.
For the Milan office we offer: free on-site gym!
Vibrant offices complete with healthy snacks, focus zones, and social areas to connect with your colleagues. Click [here] for a virtual tour and better yet, hope to see you soon!


We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

If you have any questions or need special accommodation please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. As soon as you apply your journey with sennder begins.

Title: Master Data Analyst
HTML:
Do you have good expertise in the Supply Chain and want to join an international pharma company?

We are looking for a Master Data Analyst like you!

Our client is a multinational pharma company, global leader in pain management.

The company, an expanding, structured international business, is characterized by state of the art technologies and a strong drive for innovation.

What the job looks like:

• Create and maintain material master data records in ERP system ensuring data quality and consistency;

• Sanity master data parameters check;

• Collaborate with various department including production, procurement and quality to gather needed information;

• Create and manage Change Control in the system;

• Co-ordinate the master data requirements for the introduction of new SKU’s;

• Monitoring Supply Chain KPI;

• Maintenance of Bill of Materials;

• Close collaboration with customers to gather all needed information;

• Maintain supply prices in ERP System according to contractual terms provided by the internal commercial organizations.



To make the most of this role and truly thrive, you should have:



• University Bachelors Degree or equivalent. Green Belt Six Sigma Certifications desirable;

• Experience Guidelines: minimum of 2 years in supply chain;

• Profound and comprehensive knowledge of SAP ERP module SD, MM;

• English fluent (C1);

• Strong ability with MS Excel and Microsoft Office;

• Excellent business analytics skills and striving for data-driven conclusions;

• Strong analytical skills;

• Experience with SAP ECC.


The job offer:

- a permanent contract in a constructive and stimulating workplace;

- specific training to consolidate role skills;

- pharmaceutical contract with 14 monthly salaries, production bonus, welfare, free internal canteen, smart working (35-40K).

Title: Data, Analytics & AI Analyst (STAGE)
Description:
Are you a creative, data-driven problem solver with an innovative mindset and a passion for Data Analytics & AI?

Do you have an interest in how Data, Analytics & AI solutions can support the needs of the modern world?

Are you ready to launch your career in the dynamic world of Data, Analytics & AI consulting?

Within our Data, Analytics & AI area, we are increasing our local expertise and looking for a new colleague to join as Intern, for a six-moths full-time internship. You will play a key role in applying advanced data analytics.

You will be based in our Milan office, with a hybrid way of working.




What will you do?

You will join a growing, friendly, and compelling team focused on Data, Analytics & AI topics.
You will support our Data, Analytics & AI colleagues in helping our clients understand and gain valuable insights from data, help them understand art of the possible and how to leverage the power of AI, including Generative AI, to ultimately drive tangible business growth.
You will be guided and mentored by more senior professionals that will take care of your professional growth. We work in an open and supportive environment, where new ideas and solutions are always encouraged.
You will be able to understand real business requirements and identify the best solution to achieve the expected outcome.




Whom are we looking for?

You have successfully completed a Master’s Degree in Statistics, Finance, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Business Analytics disciplines, or similar fields, gained with excellent results from a top University/Business School.
You are willing to continuously learn and research on new approach and technologies related to data management and analytics.
You are interested in data collection, interpretation, analysis as well as presentation of insights.
You know at least a coding language.
You have good communication and team-working skills.
You have a quantitative mindset and analytical approach.
You are able to communicate both in Italian and English at all levels of the Organization (other European languages will be considered as a plus).

You will have an advantage, if additionally, you have:

Previous internship experience, especially within leading consulting firms.
Knowledge of Python and/or SQL.
Knowledge of data visualization and data analytics tools like Tableau, Power BI, Spotfire, Qlik.
Knowledge of modelling.




We want to offer you a unique experience!

You will work in a global organization that is large enough to offer a wide variety of challenging opportunities, but in a local community where everyone knows your name and is always willing to offer support.
You will join our international network of Data, Analytics & AI experts and help companies to succeed in their technology ambitions.
You will be supported to continuously grow and develop your career through regular discussions with your development manager, formal training, and direct project work.
You will work with other like-minded and creative individuals to develop new ideas that have the potential to make a real difference to the businesses we work with.
We offer competitive compensation as well as a comprehensive benefits package, which includes electronic meal vouchers, and company computer and iPhone.
Are you interested in discovering more about our culture? Let's take a look at our Instagram profile.




About BearingPoint

BearingPoint is an independent management and technology consultancy with European roots and a global reach. We operate in four units: Consulting, Solutions, Business Services, and Ventures. Consulting covers the advisory business; Solutions provides the tools for successful digital transformation, advanced analytics and regulatory requirements; Business Services provides managed services beyond SaaS; Ventures drives the financing and development of start-ups.

Our clients include many of the world’s leading companies and organizations. We have a global consulting network with more than 10,000 people and support clients in over 75 countries, engaging with them to achieve measurable and sustainable success.

We are guided by our purpose – Together, we are more than business.

It revolves around three key areas of focus – More innovation, more for our planet and more for our people. Our people promises – Purpose in Practice, Deeper Connections, New Flexibility, Personal and Professional Growth, and Holistic Wellbeing and Rewards, brings together our values, aspirations, and responsibilities towards our people. It helps our people achieve and accomplish more than you can imagine possible.

We can’t do this alone. We can do this together. Join us!




Interested?

If this sounds like the ideal environment for you to work, innovate and achieve our shared purpose, join our high-performing team, apply now!




Equality & Inclusion

BearingPoint is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce where each individual feels they belong. Fostering a work environment with a strong sense of community and where everyone can thrive is a core pillar of our business.

We are focused on attracting and retaining the best people with the right skills and the desire to deliver excellent results, regardless of background. In return, we will provide a working environment in which everyone feels valued and has the opportunity to fulfill their potential, where their talents are fully utilized, and company goals are met. We celebrate the strength that comes from our similarities and our differences through local initiatives which promote inclusion, outreach, and respect.




Please click here to view our privacy policy.

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
OUR STORY

At ST, we believe in the power of technology to drive innovation and make a positive impact on people, business, and society. We are a global semiconductor company, and our advanced technology & chips forms the hidden part of the world we live in today.

When you join ST, you will be part of a global business of more than 115+ nationalities and present in 40 countries, 50,000+, diverse and dedicated creators & makers of technology around the world!

Developing technologies takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understands collaboration and respect. People with passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries and drive innovation – whilst unlocking your own potential.

Working at ST means innovating for a future that we want to make smarter, greener, in a responsible and sustainable way. Our technology starts with you. Join us and start the future!

Looking for an intern to automate specific and key business data collection, through new available AI tools, to improve the overall efficiency in business data management.

The goal of the internship is to design and implement an automated AI based system for easy and effective business data collection (from different sources), analysis and presentation aimed to reduce time and efforts spent on those data analysis and presentations creation.

Main users of the outcomes will be divisional management team.

Profile

Graduate (pre or post) in Data Analytics with good understanding of AI tools and algorithms

Open minded and used to teamwork

Good communication skills

Trustworthy and results oriented

We encourage candidates who may not meet every single requirement to apply, as we appreciate diverse perspectives and provide opportunities for growth and learning. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) is part of our company culture. Our DEI vision is, “At ST, you can be the true version of yourself”, we value all employee contributions and have zero tolerance for any kind of discrimination.

Joining us is also about a greater work-life balance and workplace with equal opportunities. Dedicated Employee Resource Groups for women and LGBTQIA+, hybrid work arrangements are amongst the many DEI & Sustainability initiatives that make us a great place to evolve your career.

To discover more, visit st.com/careers

Title: Data/Business Analyst
Description:
Per realtà tech leader nel settore e-commerce di food and beverage, operante da oltre 10 anni ma con un'anima fortemente startupper, siamo alla ricerca di un Data/Business Analyst. La risorsa lavorerà in sinergia con le diverse Business Unit aziendali, creando report continuativi per sostenere e guidare lo sviluppo dell'azienda.




Responsabilità:

Interagire con i team operativi aziendali (business, marketing, prodotto, pricing ed operations) e assistere nella guida dell'azienda verso soluzione e supportare la raccolta dei requisiti aziendali e/o funzionali.
Creare e implementare dashboard e report in linea con le linee guida per una comunicazione efficace delle informazioni per gli utenti chiave e finali;
Utilizzare tool di Business Intelligence & SQL per analisi dati, reportistica e supporto ai KPI aziendali.
Verifica e validazione dei modelli di analisi richiesti;
Identificazione dei dati necessari e definizione della logica delle query.
Dettagliare le esigenze di business dal punto di vista funzionale
Redigere documenti di analisi funzionale per le differenti Business Unit dell'azienda.







Requisiti:

Competenze analitiche nella lavorazione ed interpretazione dei dati
Esperienza tra i 3 e i 7 anni come Business Analyst/ Data Analyst
Conoscenza di SQL per query e analisi
Conoscenza di tool di BI come Qlik, Power BI, Tableau
Spiccate doti comunicative e capacità di collaborare con diversi team
Rappresenta un plus l’esperienza pregressa nel campo dell’analisi dati/ analisi funzionale in aziende Tech, Digital e/o eCommerce




More Info:

Lavoro flessibile con possibilità di smart working su base settimanale
Range Retributivo: RAL compresa tra i 30.000.00 - 45.000.00 euro
Welfare 2.000€ annui
MBO
Sede di Lavoro: Milano

Show more

Title: HR Data Analyst
HTML:
We believe in the highest standards. After all, the first step in ensuring high-quality services for our clients is to operate internally at the highest levels. KPMG Support professionals have the fundamental task of supporting the daily activities of colleagues in the Business, with dedication and proactivity.

For the strengthening of our People structure in Milan, we are looking for an HR Data Analyst professional who will be responsible for the following activities:

  • Create, develop, and update reporting systems for the Management;
  • Support the maintenance of data and oversee the accuracy of information in company systems;
  • Conduct analyses on the data available in the HR information system;
  • Contribute to the creation of interactive dashboards focused on personnel analysis to drive the overall human resources strategy;
  • Support HR processes with data and statistics.

To be the ideal candidate, you should possess:

  • Master's degree in economic disciplines;
  • 2-4 years of previous experience in the role;
  • Excellent knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite;
  • Good knowledge of the English language;
  • Passion and enthusiasm for HR issues, curiosity, and proactivity, flexible approach, and respect for deadlines.

Are you a problem solver who never loses sight of your goals? Can you build strong relationships and promote collaboration? You might be the person we are looking for!

KPMG is one of the leading networks of professional services, a leader in audit and accounting, management consulting, and tax, legal, and administrative services.

Leadership, teamwork, respect for people, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity. These are the values of KPMG that guide the behaviors of the people who work there, representing its identity and way of being, creating an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge that allows our professionals to express their full potential.

Our role is a prominent one in a context of continuous and rapid change, requiring a set of new skills and abilities to support growth ambitions and the trust the market places in us.

Driven by passion, we strive every day to promote inclusion and growth, fostering an environment where everyone feels they belong.

The requested data will be processed in absolute compliance with the provisions of European Regulation 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR" or "Privacy Regulation") and its subsequent amendments and integrations. For more information, please refer to KPMG's Privacy Policy.

KPMG Business Services ensures equal opportunities.

Title: Data Market Analysis Intern
Description:
Stage Delivery

Let’s be unstoppable together!

Circana (ex IRI e NPD) è il consulente leader nella gestione della complessità del comportamento dei consumatori. Grazie all’utilizzo di una tecnologia impareggiabile, analisi avanzate, dati cross-industry e a una profonda esperienza nel settore, forniamo quella chiarezza che aiuta quasi 7.000 marchi e rivenditori leader a livello globale ad agire e a incentivare la crescita del business. In Circana ci alimenta la passione per continuare a imparare e crescere, cerchiamo e condividiamo liberamente i feedback e festeggiamo le vittorie grandi e piccole in un ambiente flessibile e attento alle nostre esigenze lavorative e personali. Unisciti al nostro team inclusivo e impegnato ad affrontare sfide e cambiamenti con l’obiettivo di contribuire ai risultati e per sostenere insieme la nostra curiosità. Per saperne di più accedi a www.circana.com 

Responsabilità

Analisi e progetti basati su modelli econometrici e previsionali che supportano i nostri clienti nella valutazione dell’impatto dellle leve del marketing mix sulle vendite di un particolare prodotto/marca, nella definizione della strategia assortimentale da utilizzare con ciascun distributore, nella misurazione delle performance delle attività in store e nelle analisi predittive per pianificare azioni commerciali e massimizzare la performance di prodotto. Il tirocinante affiancherà il tutor aziendale prevalmentemente su attività di analisi quantitativa e di set up delle analisi nell’ambito dei progetti assegnati.

Competenze richieste

Laurea in statistica o in economia/matematica con propensione all'utilizzo di modelli statistici

Conoscenza del Pacchetto Office (Power Point ed Excel a livello avanzato)

Conoscenza di Software per estrazione dati da sistemi aziendali e per l'analisi statistica (ACCESS, SAS, SPSS)

Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese

La nostra offerta lavorativa

Stage di 6 mesi. E previsto un rimborso spese mensile di EUR 800

Formazione in aula e on-the-job

Possibilità di lavorare in un contesto strutturato e multinazionale

Esperienza nel settore delle ricerche di mercato in una delle aziende leader del settore di riferimento

Location: La posizione è prevista presso la sede di Milano.


Show more

Title: DATA ANALYST - DATA ENGINEER INTERNSHIP
Description:
Blimp: digital perception of reality

Con le nostre tecnologie proprietarie abbiamo portato le metriche digitali nel mondo reale.

Il nostro sistema -100% privacy compliant- rileva flussi di persone e veicoli negli spazi fisici, grazie alle tecnologie AI di computer vision.

Blimp è parte del gruppo e-Novia Spa, composto da circa 100 talenti politecnici, in grado di sfruttare le loro competenze tecniche e le capacità imprenditoriali per creare e implementare idee dirompenti.


https://blimp.ai/
https://e-novia.it/



Per far fronte al numero crescente di clienti -abbiamo superato le 3000 installazioni ! e per rendere il nostro servizio ancora più di successo, stiamo cercando un giovane professionista appassionato e concentrato che si unisca al team Data Engineer & Analysis come:

DATA ANALYST - DATA ENGINEER INTERNSHIP

La persona che stiamo cercando si occuperà di:


Effettuare le verifiche per certificare la qualità e la significatività del dato misurato dagli headcounter;
Utilizzare tool per l'estrazione dei dati da db SQL/NoSQL;
Preparazione dei report per il pubblico (report mobilità), per i clienti o per uso interno;
Uso (e a tendere anche la definizione/progettazione) di tool per identificare, analizzare e interpretare i pattern e trend di data set complessi per identificare anomalie e missing data



MUST HAVE


Conoscenza di almeno uno dei principali linguaggi di programmazione per l’implementazione di soluzioni di advanced analytics (Python, C#);
Familiarità con programmazione orientata agli oggetti;
Conoscenza DB relazionali SQL-based;
Buona conoscenza di Microsoft Office;
Conoscenza della lingua Inglese



NICE TO HAVE


Pregressa esperienza in ambito data analytics e/o data engineering
Conoscenza di tools di data visualization (PowerBi, KNIME, TABLEAU)
Esperienza di analisi dati con alta dipendenza spazio-temporale (serie storiche, dati geolocalizzati)
Competenze utilizzo linux
Conoscenza DB non-relazionali



COSA COMPRENDE L'OFFERTA


Ottima opportunità di crescita tecnica e professionale in un contesto dinamico e stimolante.
Mensa
Sede di lavoro: Arese / work from home



Blimp è un datore di lavoro per le pari opportunità: questo annuncio di lavoro è aperto ad entrambi i generi in conformità al decreto legislativo italiano n. 198/2006.
Show more

  • https://blimp.ai/
  • https://e-novia.it/


Per far fronte al numero crescente di clienti -abbiamo superato le 3000 installazioni ! e per rendere il nostro servizio ancora più di successo, stiamo cercando un giovane professionista appassionato e concentrato che si unisca al team Data Engineer & Analysis come:

DATA ANALYST - DATA ENGINEER INTERNSHIP

La persona che stiamo cercando si occuperà di:

  • Effettuare le verifiche per certificare la qualità e la significatività del dato misurato dagli headcounter;
  • Utilizzare tool per l'estrazione dei dati da db SQL/NoSQL;
  • Preparazione dei report per il pubblico (report mobilità), per i clienti o per uso interno;
  • Uso (e a tendere anche la definizione/progettazione) di tool per identificare, analizzare e interpretare i pattern e trend di data set complessi per identificare anomalie e missing data


MUST HAVE

  • Conoscenza di almeno uno dei principali linguaggi di programmazione per l’implementazione di soluzioni di advanced analytics (Python, C#);
  • Familiarità con programmazione orientata agli oggetti;
  • Conoscenza DB relazionali SQL-based;
  • Buona conoscenza di Microsoft Office;
  • Conoscenza della lingua Inglese


NICE TO HAVE

  • Pregressa esperienza in ambito data analytics e/o data engineering
  • Conoscenza di tools di data visualization (PowerBi, KNIME, TABLEAU)
  • Esperienza di analisi dati con alta dipendenza spazio-temporale (serie storiche, dati geolocalizzati)
  • Competenze utilizzo linux
  • Conoscenza DB non-relazionali


COSA COMPRENDE L'OFFERTA

  • Ottima opportunità di crescita tecnica e professionale in un contesto dinamico e stimolante.
  • Mensa
  • Sede di lavoro: Arese / work from home


Blimp è un datore di lavoro per le pari opportunità: questo annuncio di lavoro è aperto ad entrambi i generi in conformità al decreto legislativo italiano n. 198/2006.

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Data Quality Analyst (fixed-term contract)

sennder is Europe’s leading digital freight forwarder. In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitize and automate all road logistics processes. We are a growing team looking for a Data Quality Analyst to help us on our journey to revolutionise road freight logistics. You would join our “Operations Program & Innovation” department, based out of the Milan office and will report to the Team Lead Ops. Quality.

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

What You Will Do …

As a Data Quality Analyst you’ll work on interesting responsibilities like supporting the Operations Programs & Innovation department and specifically the Network Quality Team by analyzing and identifying logistic network inefficiencies, managing carriers delays and penalties.


Ensure compliance with service quality KPIs by monitoring and supporting continuous performance improvement.
Work together with carriers to reduce the impact of low performances through bonus/malus mechanisms.
Analyze operational issues by identifying their root causes and proposing corrective actions through daily KPIs monitoring (e.g., on-time performance, incidents).
Build supplier performance reports in order to create presentations useful to management.
Support the definition of processes with the aim of identifying best practices and improving performance.
Work closely with Operations and Program Management teams to improve our quality metrics.
Develop and maintain relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.


What We Are Looking For …


Bachelor's degree in economics, statistics, engineering, or equivalent work experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Italian and English.
Proficiency in G-Suite and MS Office (Excel & PowerPoint); essential proficiency in SQL.
Strong analytical skills to conduct analyses and translate them into actionable insights.
Proactive, self-starter with excellent organizational skills.
Strong interpersonal skills and adaptive mindset with the ability to learn quickly.
Strong team player with a collaborative attitude.


ABOUT Sennder Italia

sennder Italia, based in the heart of Milan, is a joint venture company between sennder and Poste Italiane. Our company matches the digital and innovative focus on technologies and digitalization of sennder with the expertise and know-how of the largest distribution network in Italy, Poste Italiane.

We not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we’re growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe’s inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Read more about the sennder Italia joint venture here.

What You Can Expect

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual potential of all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit and respect to build fruitful collaboration across teams. Learn more about who we are on our career site.


Fast growth scale-up with an international team of 1000 people, 74+ nationalities spread across 11 European offices. With English as our common language, we are able to work together.
Learning and development on the job and with the support of a bi-annual review process, learning allowance, high potential programs, sennder onboarding academy, and internal trainings.
Various opportunities to connect with colleagues through regular team events and company get-togethers such as our highly anticipated sennder Summer Camp.
Prioritize employee engagement and mental well-being by fostering a supportive environment through the Likeminded platform and conducting regular employee satisfaction surveys.
Hybrid work model where you seamlessly merge virtual productivity and in-office collaboration with your colleagues.
Commuter allowance to assist employees with their daily travel expenses and a one-time home office benefit to ensure that you're properly equipped wherever you work.
Competitive compensation package including objective-based bonus, referral reward, and in some cases virtual option plan.
For the Milan office we offer: free on-site gym!
Vibrant offices complete with healthy snacks, focus zones, and social areas to connect with your colleagues. Click [here] for a virtual tour and better yet, hope to see you soon!


We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

If you have any questions or need special accommodation please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. As soon as you apply your journey with sennder begins.
Show more

Title: Supply Data Analyst - Internship
Description:
Ogury is a global adtech company that delivers Personified Advertising solutions grounded in privacy to brands, agencies and publishers by focusing on targeting personas, not people.

We deliver relevant audiences at scale and on quality publisher inventory thanks to our exclusive data, which is meticulously collected and crafted from millions of self-declared customer surveys, enriched with billions of impactful data points, and refined by AI. This results in audience insights and performance not available through any other AdTech platform.

Founded in 2014, Ogury is a global organization with a diverse team of 500+ people across 17 countries.

At Ogury, our vision unites us all. But we know that it takes people from all walks of life to come together and make it happen. We embrace and celebrate what makes us different, creating a unique and winning culture where everyone feels safe, has access to the same opportunities, and is excited about bringing their most authentic self to work. Everyday.

Together we’re changing the face of adtech with values that inspire excellence, standards that encourage a leadership mindset, and an inclusive workplace where Ogurians are engaged and know they belong.

About The Role

Ogury is seeking a highly motivated Supply Data Analyst Intern to help our efforts towards data analysis. The intern will assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support our business decisions and strategic initiatives. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis and work within a dynamic and innovative tech environment.

What You Will Do


Data Collection and Cleaning: Assist in gathering data from multiple sources, including internal databases, spreadsheets, and third-party data systems. Perform data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Help maintain data quality and support data management activities.
Data Analysis: Conduct basic statistical analyses and generate reports to identify trends and patterns. Support senior analysts with more complex data analysis tasks. Utilize tools such as Excel, SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Reporting and Visualization: Create data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Metabase as the main tool. Present analytical findings to team members and stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Support and Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Assist in developing and implementing data collection systems and strategies to optimize data efficiency and quality.
Learning and Development: Stay current with industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance analytical skills and knowledge.


About You


Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel; knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools such as Metabase is a plus.
Basic understanding of statistical methods and data analysis techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with programming languages such as Python.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and tools.
Experience with big data tools and technologies.


Show more

Title: Junior – Artificial Intelligence and Data – Roma, Milano, Napoli - Consulting
Description:
Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team di Artificial Intelligence and Data di Deloitte Consulting nelle sedi di Roma/Milano/Napoli, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Nel Team di Artificial Intelligence & Data avrai l’occasione di aiutare, in ambito Analytics, le aziende a valorizzare i dati provenienti da fonti eterogenee trasformandoli in informazioni accurate e immediatamente utilizzabili, elementi indispensabili per quelle aziende che vogliono fare decision-making fact-driven. La Offering Artificial Intelligence & Data è pertanto l’opzione best in class nell’individuazione, progettazione e implementazione di soluzioni di Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Visualization, Big Data Management, con un approccio agnostico dal punto di vista tecnologico.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:


Interpretare proattivamente i bisogni del cliente, individuando metodologie e approcci coerenti
Sviluppare iniziative e soluzioni in modo indipendente, raccogliendo ed analizzando dati a supporto dell’elaborazione di soluzioni per i clienti
Elaborare teaser e presentazioni per supportare il top management
Individuare potenziali rischi e criticità e condividerli tempestivamente con il resto del team
Collaborare efficacemente in team eterogenei ed internazionali


Winning Requirements


Brillante percorso accademico con laurea specialistica in materie STEM
Familiarità con la modellazione e linguaggio di interrogazione dei data base; conoscenza di uno o più linguaggi di accesso al dato e programmazione (Python, R, Java, SQL); ottima conoscenza degli applicativi MS Word, MS Excel e MS Power Point; nozioni accademiche di modelli statistici per l’analisi dei dati
Forte propensione/interesse per le nuove tecnologie e per l’informatica
Elevata attitudine a lavorare sia autonomamente che in team, capacità analitiche e di problem solving, gestione dello stress, flessibilità, precisione e uno spiccato orientamento al raggiungimento dei risultati
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese; disponibilità a lavorare in trasferta, anche all’estero


Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Product Team
Description:
About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments; we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone’s life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

🚀 Join us as Data Analyst - Product Team and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Data Analyst, Product Team, you will join the Tech & Product team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission


Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the product through research and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
Analyze performance. Conduct thorough analysis of product usage and performance data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
Generate actionable insights. Distill insights from big data and make recommendations to drive product decisions and future developments.
Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product enhancements.
Create and maintain dashboards. Track key metrics and visualize insights to inform stakeholders and drive data-driven decisions.
Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.


Your Ideal Profile


Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 3+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios. Experience in Product Analytics is a plus.
Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.


Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

🙆🏻 Join an international team to grow with

🏡 Hybrid working policy

🍽️ Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

🌐 Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

⭐ Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget

🚀 Own part of Satispay’s success with our Stock Option Plan

👩🏻‍💻 Gear up with our tech equipment

🥳 Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us

Curious about our core values? Explore them here.
