HTML:
About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments; we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone’s life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

🚀 Join us as Data Analyst - Product Team and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Data Analyst, Product Team, you will join the Tech & Product team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission

  • Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the product through research and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
  • Analyze performance. Conduct thorough analysis of product usage and performance data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
  • Generate actionable insights. Distill insights from big data and make recommendations to drive product decisions and future developments.
  • Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product enhancements.
  • Create and maintain dashboards. Track key metrics and visualize insights to inform stakeholders and drive data-driven decisions.
  • Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
  • Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
  • Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.

Your Ideal Profile

  • Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 3+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios. Experience in Product Analytics is a plus.
  • Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
  • Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
  • Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
  • Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

🙆🏻 Join an international team to grow with

🏡 Hybrid working policy

🍽️ Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

🌐 Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

⭐ Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget

🚀 Own part of Satispay’s success with our Stock Option Plan

👩🏻‍💻 Gear up with our tech equipment

🥳 Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
MeJobby, agenzia per il lavoro 100% in cloud, con Autorizzazione Ministeriale n. 0000004.20-05-2021 cerca per importante società operante di Marketing e Comunicazione un/una Data Analyst.

Mansioni:

  • analisi di serie di dati e della loro accuratezza;
  • identificazione di modelli e tendenze;
  • presentazione dei risultati sotto forma di grafici analitici


Requisiti:

  • Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Ingegneria o affini;
  • Esperienza di almeno 2 anni come Data Analyst;
  • Conoscenza di linguaggio Phyton oppure R;
  • Attitudine al lavoro in team ed attenzione ai dettagli


Orario di lavoro: full-time, dal lunedì al venerdì

Sede di lavoro: Milano

RAL commisurata all'esperienza del candidato

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad ambo i sessi.

I candidati possono inviare un CV con autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi dell'art. 13 d. lgs. 30 giugno 2003 n°196 - "Codice in materia di protezione dei dati personali" e dell'art. 6* e 13 GDPR 679/16 - "Regolamento europeo sulla protezione dei dati personali".

Title: BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE SPECIALIST
Description:
The candidate will work in the R&D Product Factory, as part of the Business Intelligence & AI team with other experts in the field and will report to the BI & Data Science Lead.




The main activities required to the selected candidate aims at consolidating and widening the general knowledge and technological knowhow of RGI in the field of the Business Intelligence.




Responsibilities:

Implement reports and dashboards leveraging best in class business intelligence tool (e.g. Qlik Sense)
Conduct analysis on insurance business topics: interview with client, formalization of business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports and dashboards
Design & build management information dashboards to monitor internal processes and answer business questions about trends, opportunities, and data quality issues
Became responsible of specific project stream, ensuring a high level of data quality for core data sources and relevant KPIs
Research tools, frameworks and mechanisms for data analytics providing input to new technology opportunities that will have an impact on the company BI systems
Collaborate with Data Scientists in the RGI R&D Innovation Department, contributing in the development of new algorithms and models, providing application with vertical focus on the Insurance Industry




Experiences: 1-3 years’ experience in a Business intelligence and Analytics position.




Technical competences:

Previous experience with the business intelligence tool Qlik Sense/Qlik View
Proficiency in database query construction and data mining (SQL, PL/SQL)
Experience in ETL tools (e.g. Talend, IBM DataStage, Business Objects, Alteryx, etc.) and management of databases is a strong plus
Knowledge with one of the following languages: Python, R, MATLAB, SAS is a plus
Knowledge of big data architecture and data manipulation tools, based on Cloudera and HortonWorks (e.g. Apache Spark, Elasticsearch, Kafka….) is a plus
Proven capability to quickly grasp new processes and technologies
Fluent in Italian
Professional English Knowledge




Personal skills:

Attitude at team-working
Commitment, precision, autonomy
Willingness of learning and delivering innovation-based products to a wider audience
Attention to detail, passion for processes, systems and data mining




Education: The candidate will have a Master’s Degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or a related quantitative discipline.







This announcement is addressed to candidates of both sexes pursuant to the law (L.903 / 77 and Legislative Decree No. 98/2006, art. 27). The interested party is invited to send his / her application by giving specific consent to the processing of personal data, pursuant to the new European Privacy Law, in accordance with articles 13 and 14 of the GDPR (Regulation (EU), 27 April 2016, n. 2016/679).

Title: internship data analyst
Description:
JUNIOR DATA ANALYST - INTERNSHIP




Vuoi far parte di un contesto internazionale e in forte crescita?




Entra a far parte di CRIF, un’azienda globale specializzata nello sviluppo e nella gestione di sistemi di informazioni creditizie (SIC), di business information e di soluzioni per il credito.




La mission che guida tutti noi di CRIF è creare valore, aiutando le aziende nel miglioramento delle performance e i consumatori nella gestione consapevole del proprio credito attraverso una gamma completa di soluzioni e competenze professionali.




A fronte di un costante trend di crescita, siamo alla ricerca di:




INTERNSHIP DATA ANALYST




Verifica e lavorazione dei dati finanziari




Stiamo cercando una risorsa che entrerà a far parte del Team Data Quality, (area Data & Solutions Management) che ha l’obiettivo di assicurare la qualità e l’aggiornamento dei dati su piattaforma per la creazione di report e soluzioni di Risk Management, Marketing e Supply Management per le imprese.




Ruolo e Responsabilità




Avrai la responsabilità di analizzare e verificare la correttezza dei dati inseriti nel database;
Effettuerai analisi proattive sulla banca dati volte ad identificare margini di efficientamento nei flussi e strategie ottimali per migliorare la qualità del dato;
Raggiungerai una migliore elaborazione dei risultati delle tue analisi grazie ad un costante affiancamento;
Parteciperai attivamente a progetti per il cliente;
Supporterai le attività consulenziali focalizzate sull’implementazione di prodotti e servizi;
Sarai coinvolto nello sviluppo di mercato e di business dell’area.




Competenze ricercate




Laurea in economia, ingegneria, statistica o discipline affini
Conoscenza e competenza in ambito SQL
Conoscenza e competenza di Access, Excel, Power Point e Word
Conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese
Ottime doti relazionali e comunicative
Orientamento al raggiungimento degli obiettivi
Buona attitudine a lavorare in team
Predisposizione all’analisi
Buona gestione dello stress e del tempo nel rispetto delle scadenze




Le ricerche sono rivolte a candidati dell'uno e dell'altro sesso ai sensi della L. 903/77 e L. 125/91.




I candidati interessati dovranno inviare la propria candidatura dichiarando espressamente il loro consenso al trattamento dei dati personali (art. 13 del D. Lgs. 196/2003 e art. 13 GDPR 679/16)

Title: Junior Data Analyst (Insurance)
HTML:
Mavriq, divisione B2C di Moltiply Group, è la tech company a cui appartengono alcuni tra i più importanti brand di comparazione ed intermediazione online in Italia (MutuiOnline.it, Segugio.it, SOStariffe.it, Trovaprezzi.it e molti altri) e all’estero (LeLynx.fr, Rastreator.com e Rastreator.mx). I servizi offerti dai brand di Mavriq aiutano con trasparenza i consumatori a trovare ciò di cui hanno bisogno, al miglior prezzo. Mavriq conta oggi più di 800 persone distribuite in Europa, America Latina ed Asia.


Posizione

Il nostro team Insurance è alla ricerca di un/una brillante neolaureato per la posizione di Junior Data Analyst.

Come Junior Data Analyst avrai il compito di supportare il team nella definizione e realizzazione di progetti strategici con l'obiettivo di garantire il miglior livello di servizio per rispondere alla crescente domanda dei nostri Clienti. Ti occuperai della creazione di modelli quantitativi e dashboard a supporto dello sviluppo di Segugio.it e del miglioramento delle performance dei processi di business, affiancandoti a data analyst esperti ed acquisendo una profonda conoscenza del business assicurativo e dell’online.


Più nel dettaglio:

  • Svilupperai ed implementerai modelli quantitativi e dashboard;
  • Supporterai la direzione Insurance nell’ottimizzazione dei processi esistenti e nello sviluppo di nuove attività/processi/linee di business;
  • Lavorerai in sinergia con le diverse funzioni aziendali per sviluppare, testare ed ottimizzare i processi.
  • Requisiti
  • Neolaureato STEM o statistica;
  • Ottime capacità analitiche e propensione all'implementazione di modelli matematici e predittivi;
  • Precisione e attenzione nell'esecuzione delle attività;
  • Conoscenza avanzata di Microsoft Excel;
  • Proattività, predisposizione al lavoro in team;
  • Conoscenza di R o Python, Tableau e SQL verranno considerati un plus.


Cosa troverai da noi

  • Un ambiente di lavoro giovane e stimolante;
  • Colleghi altrettanto appassionati con cui confrontarti e imparare (e anche a cui insegnare qualcosa di nuovo);
  • Possibilità di contribuire attivamente ai successi dell'azienda e di veder riconosciuti i tuoi meriti indipendentemente dalla tua seniority;
  • Flessibilità, smart working e welfare;
  • Incontri periodici di feedback che ti permetteranno di accrescere la tua professionalità e migliorare le tue performance;
  • Momenti di aggregazione, condivisione e celebrazione dei successi;
  • Iniziative volte alla formazione ed allo scambio di competenze;
  • Possibilità di lavorare con un team d’eccellenza in ambito assicurativo diretto.


Se credi che questa sia l'azienda giusta per te, mandaci il tuo CV!


Sede di lavoro: Milano, via Desenzano 2 (MM Gambara)



La ricerca è rivolta ad ambo i sessi (ai sensi delle Leggi n. 903/77 e n. 125/91).


Si richiede esplicito consenso al trattamento dei dati personali (ex D.Lgs. 196/03 e GDPR - Reg.UE. 2016/679).

Title: Data Warehouse Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

La funzione ICT sviluppa e gestisce le applicazioni software e l'infrastruttura tecnologica della Banca. Promuove la razionalizzazione in azienda di tutti i processi di lavoro, a supporto delle linee di business, tramite la rilevazione delle esigenze di servizi informatici e promozione delle opportunità tecnologiche offerte dall'evoluzione del sistema informativo.

Descrizione dell'attività

Inserita all'interno dell'area Data Warehouse, la persona da noi ricercata sarà chiamata a svolgere le seguenti attività:


Analizzare le esigenze degli utenti interni in termini di reporting e analisi.
Esplicitare i fabbisogni informativi.
Disegnare e implementare le procedure di integrazione dati dai sistemi alimentanti.
Definire e implementare i reports e le analisi sui dati.



Requirements


Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o Statistica/Matematica.
Interesse verso le tematiche di modellazione dati, sviluppo e gestione database, business intelligence.
Conoscenza di almeno un database fra MS SQL Server, MS Access, Oracle, Sybase, MySQL.



Costituiscono Titolo Preferenziale


Esperienza con Analysis Services (SSAS).
Conoscenza di un qualche tool di business intelligence (per esempio PowerBI).



Si desidera entrare in contatto con persone che si distinguono per le ottime capacità relazionali, affidabilità ed autonomia organizzativa.

Completano il profilo una forte determinazione ed orientamento al risultato, una personalità vivace e proattiva, con ottime capacità organizzative e doti di riservatezza e affidabilità.

Other information

Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Tipo di contratto: CCNL credito, tempo indeterminato

Il Gruppo Fineco è orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversità, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro. Fineco “The Place To Be”

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.

Write the next chapter of your ABB story.

This position reports to

Pricing Specialist

Your role and responsibilities

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with sales, marketing and product functions providing data and statistics to support existing and potential products, systems, and/or services strategy. Each day, you will support the implementation, development and maintenance of region statistics (costs, sales, prices, orders, etc.) through big data tools like PowerBI. You will support sales with statistics and scorecard tracking and provide computing expertise to the organization. You will also showcase your expertise by working with the team on new development dashboards.

The work model for the role is:

This role contributes to the Electrification - Installation Products Business Line in Sesto San Giovanni (MI).

You will be mainly accountable for:


Constructing and fitting statistical, machine learning, or optimization models and developing appropriate advanced statistical methods
Designing database systems
Ensuring high-quality analysis and extracting data from sales/financial tools to support KPI tracking
Assisting in the development of statistical analysis tools
Collaborating with internal stakeholders to understand business challenges and develop analytical solutions
Supporting regional teams in the best use of tracking system and monitoring ongoing data quality.
Suggesting improvements concerning statistics creation and maintenance.
Documenting, reviewing and updating all documents on tools and database setup


You will join a dynamic and talented team, where you will be able to thrive.


Qualifications For The Role


Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or similar
Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerBI - DAX and Power Query. R and Phyton are a plus
You are passionate about data management and structures. Knowledge of costs and profitability KPIs is preferred
You enjoy working in a team and you have a good interpersonal attitude
You are goal-oriented, precise in following procedures and have a problem solving attitude
You are at ease communicating in both Italian and English languages


What's in it for you?


Work in a company with a strong technology legacy and deeply rooted in local communities
Bring your knowledge and expertise, make the difference in technology
Flexibility: we have hybrid work options, make the best out of them!


More about us

ABB Installation Products Division (formerly Thomas&Betts), helps manage the connection, protection and distribution of electrical power from source to socket. The Division’s products are engineered to provide ease of installation and perform in demanding and harsh conditions, helping to ensure safety and continuous operation for utilities, businesses and people around the world. The Commercial Essentials product segment includes electrical junction boxes, commercial fittings, strut and cable tray metal framing systems for commercial and residential construction. The Premier Industrial product segment includes multiple product lines, such as Ty-Rap® cable ties, T&B Liquidtight Systems® protection products, PVC coated and nylon conduit systems, power connection and grounding systems, and cable protection systems of conduits and fittings for harsh and industrial applications. The Division also manufactures solutions for medium-voltage applications used in the utility market under its marquee brands including Elastimold™ reclosers and switchgear, capacitor switches, current limiting fuses, Homac™ distribution connectors, Hi-Tech Valiant™ full-range current limiting fuse for fire mitigation, faulted current indicators and distribution connectors, cable accessories and apparatus with products for overhead and underground distribution. Manufacturing includes made-to-stock and custom-made solutions.

We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

For further info: Davide Lippiello, Talent Partner


92793677


Show more

Your role and responsibilities

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with sales, marketing and product functions providing data and statistics to support existing and potential products, systems, and/or services strategy. Each day, you will support the implementation, development and maintenance of region statistics (costs, sales, prices, orders, etc.) through big data tools like PowerBI. You will support sales with statistics and scorecard tracking and provide computing expertise to the organization. You will also showcase your expertise by working with the team on new development dashboards.

The work model for the role is:

This role contributes to the Electrification - Installation Products Business Line in Sesto San Giovanni (MI).

You will be mainly accountable for:

  • Constructing and fitting statistical, machine learning, or optimization models and developing appropriate advanced statistical methods
  • Designing database systems
  • Ensuring high-quality analysis and extracting data from sales/financial tools to support KPI tracking
  • Assisting in the development of statistical analysis tools
  • Collaborating with internal stakeholders to understand business challenges and develop analytical solutions
  • Supporting regional teams in the best use of tracking system and monitoring ongoing data quality.
  • Suggesting improvements concerning statistics creation and maintenance.
  • Documenting, reviewing and updating all documents on tools and database setup

You will join a dynamic and talented team, where you will be able to thrive.


Qualifications For The Role

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or similar
  • Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerBI - DAX and Power Query. R and Phyton are a plus
  • You are passionate about data management and structures. Knowledge of costs and profitability KPIs is preferred
  • You enjoy working in a team and you have a good interpersonal attitude
  • You are goal-oriented, precise in following procedures and have a problem solving attitude
  • You are at ease communicating in both Italian and English languages

What's in it for you?

  • Work in a company with a strong technology legacy and deeply rooted in local communities
  • Bring your knowledge and expertise, make the difference in technology
  • Flexibility: we have hybrid work options, make the best out of them!

More about us

ABB Installation Products Division (formerly Thomas&Betts), helps manage the connection, protection and distribution of electrical power from source to socket. The Division’s products are engineered to provide ease of installation and perform in demanding and harsh conditions, helping to ensure safety and continuous operation for utilities, businesses and people around the world. The Commercial Essentials product segment includes electrical junction boxes, commercial fittings, strut and cable tray metal framing systems for commercial and residential construction. The Premier Industrial product segment includes multiple product lines, such as Ty-Rap® cable ties, T&B Liquidtight Systems® protection products, PVC coated and nylon conduit systems, power connection and grounding systems, and cable protection systems of conduits and fittings for harsh and industrial applications. The Division also manufactures solutions for medium-voltage applications used in the utility market under its marquee brands including Elastimold™ reclosers and switchgear, capacitor switches, current limiting fuses, Homac™ distribution connectors, Hi-Tech Valiant™ full-range current limiting fuse for fire mitigation, faulted current indicators and distribution connectors, cable accessories and apparatus with products for overhead and underground distribution. Manufacturing includes made-to-stock and custom-made solutions.

We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

For further info: Davide Lippiello, Talent Partner


92793677

Title: Data Operations Analyst
Description:
Adecco Consultant ricerca per Hoya Lens Italia, azienda Multinazionale Giapponese settore oftalmico, con sede a Garbagnate M.se, un/una :




Data Operations Analyst




La risorsa verrà inserita all’interno del Global Rx Control & Support Team e avrà la responsabilità della preparazione e mantenimento di tutta la reportistica di produzione a livello internazionale, in affiancamento ad altre risorse già presenti. Dovrà garantire l'integrità, la qualità e la disponibilità dei dati, supportando le decisioni strategiche attraverso l'analisi, con particolare attenzione al miglioramento dei KPI e dei processi produttivi.




Titolo di studi:

Laurea in facoltà tecnico scientifiche STEM, con particolare focus a laureati nell’ambito tecnico/Ingegneristico.




Responsabilità principali:

Preparare e mantenere report di produzione a livello internazionale.
Assicurare l'integrità, la qualità e la disponibilità dei dati.
Supportare le decisioni strategiche attraverso analisi dei dati.
Concentrarsi sul miglioramento dei KPI e dei processi produttivi.
Collaborare con il team globale per ottimizzare i processi e migliorare le performance.




Competenze necessarie:

Esperienza, seppur breve, in ruoli similari in contesti produttivi strutturati.

Lingua inglese fluente (scritta e parlata).

Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office, con particolare attenzione a Excel.
Eccellente capacità di analisi.
Attenzione ai dettagli e forte orientamento alla qualità dei dati.
Comunicare efficacemente con diverse figure/ruoli a livello internazionale.
Abilità nel gestire più compiti contemporaneamente rispettando le scadenze richieste.




Si offre

Contratto di lavoro a tempo indeterminato con RAL commisurata all’esperienza maturata
E’ previsto un primo periodo di formazione in produzione, al fine di capire e conoscere tutti i processi produttivi e le dinamiche operative




Sede di lavoro: Garbagnate Milanese (MI)

Orario: Full time

Title: Stage Business Intelligence
Description:
Società

Banca Mediolanum spa

Posizione




Stage Business Intelligence




Responsabilità primarie

L’ufficio Business Intelligence, parte dell’Unità di supporto manageriale Market e Business Intelligence all'interno della Direzione Servizi di Investimento e Assicurativi, si occupa di fornire alle varie Direzioni della Banca, in modo approfondito e fattuale, analisi qualitative e quantitative sulle dinamiche aziendali in relazione ai prodotti, ai clienti ed ai relativi canali a supporto delle valutazioni di business e di offerta.

Siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire in stage nel team che, con competenza, precisione ed entusiasmo, possa contribuire a generare valore verso gli stakeholders interni ed affrontare al meglio le sfide che il contesto pone.

La risorsa lavorerà con gli altri specialisti dell’ufficio, ed in sinergia con le altre anime che compongono l’Unità, a diretto riporto del responsabile di Business Intelligence ed avrà il compito di utilizzare le informazioni ottenute dai dati per permettere di prendere decisioni consapevoli ed efficaci al fine di elaborare strategie utili al business.




Nello specifico, il/la tirocinante fornirà supporto operativo alle seguenti attività:

fornire alle varie funzioni aziendali indicazioni utili per una efficace ed efficiente comprensione del valore dei clienti attraverso analisi quali/quantitative sulle caratteristiche e le esigenze della Customer Base in relazione ai prodotti ed ai relativi canali;
comprendere i bisogni, tradurre le esigenze e le domande di business in approcci analitici solidi, efficaci e convincenti utilizzando differenti tecniche di analisi e visualizzazione dati;
comunicare in maniera efficace gli insight ai principali stakeholders, anche non analitici, in modo da supportarli nel processo decisionale;
creazione di report direzionali sulle dinamiche aziendali erogati attraverso il tool di BI adottato in azienda (Microsoft Power BI) in un’ottica di self-service BI.




Profilo competenze

Requisiti

laurea magistrale in discipline economiche o statistiche;
ottima padronanza del linguaggio di programmazione SQL e di Microsoft PowerBI;
conoscenza di almeno un tool statistico/linguaggio di programmazione (p.e. R, Python);
completano il profilo un forte orientamento al risultato e agli obbiettivi aziendali, spirito di iniziativa e proattività.

Sede di lavoro: Basiglio (MI). Smartworking settimanale.

I dati richiesti verranno trattati nell’assoluto rispetto delle disposizioni contenute nel Regolamento Europeo 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR” o “Normativa Privacy”) e sue successive modificazioni ed integrazioni.

Gruppo Mediolanum si impegna a garantire la parità di trattamento a tutti i candidati secondo i principi di Diversity and Inclusion.

Title: Analista Data Governance
Description:
NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, è tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services.

Con più di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicità, talento ed attitudine.

Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l’ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorità. Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunità e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.

Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!

www.nttdata.com/it

Responsibilities

Il candidato scelto sarà inserito all'interno del Center Of Excellence Informatica parte della practice “Data Intelligence” di NTT DATA Italia.

Un analista della governance dei dati è specializzato nella gestione dei flussi di informazioni incluse l'integrità, l'efficienza e la disponibilità dei dati. Avrà in compito di confrontarsi con il cliente e gli stakeholder di progetto al fine di indirizzare le giuste scelte tecnologiche e di business in modo da rendere fruibili, validi e facilmente consultabili i dati aziendali. Sarà premiante la conoscenza dell’intera suite di Data Governance dei principali vendor con particolare attenzione alla suite Informatica, ivi compresa la componente di Master Data Management.

Rientrano Nei Suoi Compiti


Analisi dell’ecosistema del cliente, delle best practice e dei modelli di governance in uso;
Analisi dei flussi dei dati tra sistemi;
Supporto al disegno dei flussi tramite soluzioni Informatica, delle regole di qualità e della definizione del Business Glossary e del suo popolamento attraverso gli strumenti di catalogazione, come:
Informatica Axon
Informatica Enterprise Data Catalog (EDC)
Informatica MDM



Required Skills


Laurea in discipline tecniche o economiche.
Esperienza di almeno 3 anni nell’ambito di Data Governance.
Profonda conoscenza dei principali strumenti della suite Informatica Axon, EDC, MDM.



Completano Il Profilo


Conoscenza di altri prodotti di Data Governance quali Collibra Governance, Talend Data Management Platform, SAS Data Management, etc..
Capacità di stesura della documentazione in lingua inglese.
Esperienze progettuali con in principali Cloud Provider (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, IBM Cloud)



Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Roma, Salerno, Torino
Show more

Title: Data Marketing Analyst- Fixed Term Contract
Description:
YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP is the world leader in online luxury and fashion that comprises a complete luxury retail ecosystem. The Group sells directly to customers globally through its own family of multi-brand online shops NET-A-PORTER, MR PORTER, YOOX and THE OUTNET. The Group’s Online Flagship Stores Division partners with many leading luxury brands to power their own e-commerce destinations.

The Group has 4.3 million high-spending active customers globally. As pioneers in bringing together the realms of technology and luxury, YOOX NET-A-PORTER satisfies the most discerning clientele with expertly curated products from the world’s most coveted brands, personalised end-to-end service, the latest technology and inspiring content, all shaped by 20 years of insights into the modern shopper.

Our Digital Marketing division are now seeking a talented Digital Marketing Analyst to join the team. Some of the essentials for you to know are:

Location: our office in Milan

Department Size: 4 (Approx.)

Reporting into: Analytics & Insights Manager

Besides a competitive salary, we can offer you:



A pension that both you and the company contribute too
A portal with an array of discounts on things like theme park and cinema tickets
Our famous staff discount along with exclusive staff sales
Private healthcare for you and your family
Flexible working
A chance to be part of a fun and caring team that support each other



Here is a breakdown of what you’ll be doing:



Be the go-to expert for needs on customer insight, customer behaviour and customer base development for your stakeholders.
Understand and analyse commercial and customers KPIs and main drivers.
Guide decisions by providing detailed, action orientated insights, continuously highlighting potential opportunities and risks.
Be experienced in communicating insight, both verbally and via documentation, in the most suitable, comprehensible, and impactful way for your stakeholders.
Develop collaborative relationships with your stakeholders and a deep understanding of their business areas, enabling you to develop hypotheses and make relevant, credible recommendations that flow from your insights.
Guide projects to create statistical model to support and integrate customer and traffic model and to automatize process and reports.



The type of person we are looking for:



Bachelor’s Degree: Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economic
At least 2 years of experience in Analytics Team
Demonstrated analytical experience including familiarity with concepts of forecasting, budgeting and data interpretation and analysis
Intermediate up to advanced proficiency in Excel
Experience performing ad hoc analysis using data reporting tools
Very strong analytics skills
Strong communications and interpersonal skills
Proactive problem-solver
Flexibility to perform in complex business environment.



From the moment you join the YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP we are committed to making your journey with us inspirational and evolutionary. If you are passionate, committed and thrive in a collaborative and fast-paced environment, then please apply with a CV.

YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP is an equal opportunities employer, we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply. We recognize and celebrate the benefits that diversity brings to our workplace, our business and our customers. We welcome and will consider all applications regardless of race and nationality, religion, color, sex, pregnancy or related medical conditions, parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any other legally protected characteristics.

If you require any reasonable adjustments to complete your application, please do not hesitate to advise us accordingly.

Experience Level: Associate

Workplace Type: Hybrid

Title: Manufacturing Engineering Data Analyst
Description:
Role Summary/Purpose

Job Description Summary Job Description

Ensure manufacturing data reliability between MES & ERP, analyze & drive productivity improvement (time, methods, direct & indirect costs), support ERP master data

Main Responsibilities


Production Analytics
Collect data and execute routine analyses using vested methods and technologies
Interact with people from the manufacturing departments (production manager, supervisors and operators)
Key User of MES system and interface with global MES support team (in English)
Execute routine and complex analysis to improve and control production KPI as efficiency and leakage
Productivity Improvement
Identify opportunities and lead actions for productivity improvement in terms of output & volumes
Work close to site controller to analyze FPC costs, variances and drive actions for optimization
ERP Master Data
Support Time & Methods dept including ERP master data management

Qualifications/Requirements


University degree i n Management/Industrial Engineering
1-3 years of experience in a similar role
EU Work Permit
English proficiency
Use of Excel


Desired Characteristics


Strong oral and written communication skills, interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Team building
SAP PP/CO/MM - desirable
MES systems - desirable


Additional Information

Relocation Assistance Provided: No

Title: Data Analyst -Freelance P.IVA- Hybrid su Vimercate
Description:
Safeguard Global è una società internazionale attiva sul mercato dal 2008, specializzata in Global Workforce Management operativa in 170 paesi nel mondo, con ad oggi più di 1800 dipendenti. La nostra Vision è Work in Any Way, infatti crediamo che i confini non dovrebbero essere barriere al business o al talento.

Posizione:

Siamo alla ricerca di un brillante Data Analyst jr - Digital Analyst - Web Analyst per un importante progetto di refactoring all'interno del settore industry. Il candidato avrà l'opportunità di lavorare con strumenti all'avanguardia come Mixpanel e SalesForce, e avrà un ruolo chiave nell'analisi dei dati, nel troubleshooting e nel testing.

Responsabilità:

Estrazione e raccolta di dati da diverse fonti.

Pulizia dei dati per garantire la loro accuratezza, completezza e uniformità.

Analisi dei dati per identificare tendenze, anomalie e opportunità di miglioramento.

Creazione di report e presentazioni per comunicare i risultati delle analisi ai team interni.

Collaborazione con altri dipartimenti per supportare la raccolta di dati e l'implementazione di soluzioni basate sui dati.

Requisiti:

Competenze tecniche richieste:

Ottima conoscenza di Excel e PowerPoint per l'analisi dei dati e la creazione di presentazioni.

Buona conoscenza di SQL per l'estrazione e la manipolazione dei dati.

Buona conoscenza degli strumenti di Data Visualization come Qlik ,Tableau, ecc., per la creazione di dashboard e report interattivi.

Conoscenza base di Python come ulteriore plus per l'analisi dei dati.

Capacità di gestire presentazioni e comunicare efficacemente i risultati,

Fluente italiano e inglese.

Competenze Funzionali:

Ottime doti comunicative

Altre informazioni:

Se sei un professionista appassionato di analisi dei dati e vuoi fare la differenza in un progetto di grande rilevanza, non esitare a candidarti!

La sede di lavoro è Vimercate con 2 giorno di presenza alla settimana. I restanti giorni sono in full remote working.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto a entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03
Show more
HTML:
Safeguard Global è una società internazionale attiva sul mercato dal 2008, specializzata in Global Workforce Management operativa in 170 paesi nel mondo, con ad oggi più di 1800 dipendenti. La nostra Vision è Work in Any Way, infatti crediamo che i confini non dovrebbero essere barriere al business o al talento.

Posizione:

Siamo alla ricerca di un brillante Data Analyst jr - Digital Analyst - Web Analyst per un importante progetto di refactoring all'interno del settore industry. Il candidato avrà l'opportunità di lavorare con strumenti all'avanguardia come Mixpanel e SalesForce, e avrà un ruolo chiave nell'analisi dei dati, nel troubleshooting e nel testing.

Responsabilità:

Estrazione e raccolta di dati da diverse fonti.

Pulizia dei dati per garantire la loro accuratezza, completezza e uniformità.

Analisi dei dati per identificare tendenze, anomalie e opportunità di miglioramento.

Creazione di report e presentazioni per comunicare i risultati delle analisi ai team interni.

Collaborazione con altri dipartimenti per supportare la raccolta di dati e l'implementazione di soluzioni basate sui dati.

Requisiti:

Competenze tecniche richieste:

Ottima conoscenza di Excel e PowerPoint per l'analisi dei dati e la creazione di presentazioni.

Buona conoscenza di SQL per l'estrazione e la manipolazione dei dati.

Buona conoscenza degli strumenti di Data Visualization come Qlik ,Tableau, ecc., per la creazione di dashboard e report interattivi.

Conoscenza base di Python come ulteriore plus per l'analisi dei dati.

Capacità di gestire presentazioni e comunicare efficacemente i risultati,

Fluente italiano e inglese.

Competenze Funzionali:

Ottime doti comunicative

Altre informazioni:

Se sei un professionista appassionato di analisi dei dati e vuoi fare la differenza in un progetto di grande rilevanza, non esitare a candidarti!

La sede di lavoro è Vimercate con 2 giorno di presenza alla settimana. I restanti giorni sono in full remote working.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto a entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Perché assistere al cambiamento, quando puoi guidarlo? In Accenture, potrai crescere in un ambiente inclusivo e rispettoso della tua unicità e dei tuoi valori, sviluppando le tue abilità con programmi di training continuativi ed esperienziali. Scopri cosa significa lavorare al cuore del cambiamento e accompagna le aziende più importanti nel loro percorso di trasformazione digitale. Il tuo ruolo e le tue prospettive Entra a far parte del nostro network internazionale di talenti Technology in ambito Data & AI. Lavorerai con tecnologie innovative su progetti entusiasmanti, liberando la potenza dei dati e dell'intelligenza artificiale per trasformare i processi di business. In particolare, potrai:



Progettare e implementare modelli di dati specifici che aiutino a prendere decisioni aziendali migliori e più rapide attraverso l’analisi di una combinazione di dati esterni e interni


Modellare dati, creare pipeline di dati, implementare data lake, utilizzando framework di programmazione scalabili


Implementare procedure statistiche di qualità dei dati sulle sorgenti dati e applicare rigorose analisi iterative per supportare i data scientist nell'approvvigionamento e nella preparazione dei dati per visualizzarli e sintetizzare informazioni generando valore aziendale


Definire gli standard di gestione dei dati e delle politiche di gestione, quali, ad esempio, l'anonimizzazione



Se vuoi fare della tua passione una carriera e hai le seguenti caratteristiche, ti stiamo aspettando:



Hai terminato o stai per terminare un percorso di studi in Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica o Statistica


Sei creativo, impari in fretta e ami pensare fuori dal coro


Sei appassionato e vuoi approfondire tematiche quali: Data Architecture, Data Warehouse, Data Modeling, Data Integration, Data Transformation, Data Visualization, Big Data Technologies (Cloudera, AWS, Azure, Google, Snowflake), Spark, Python, Kafka, etc.



Scopri di più su di noi

Accenture è un’azienda globale di servizi professionali con capacità avanzate in campo digitale, cloud e security. Combinando un’esperienza unica e competenze specialistiche in più di 40 settori industriali, fornisce servizi in ambito Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Industry X, Operations e Accenture Song, sostenuta dalla più ampia rete di Advanced Technology e Intelligent Operations centers a livello mondiale.

I nostri 750.000 talenti combinano ogni giorno tecnologia e ingegno umano, servendo clienti in oltre 120 Paesi.

Se desideri prepararti al meglio al nostro processo di selezione ti invitiamo a consultare la nostra sezione FAQ: https://www.accenture.com/it-it/careers/recruiting-faq-answers

Policy Qualora il tuo percorso di selezione andasse a buon fine, avrai la possibilità di aderire all’Accordo di smart working, ove compatibile con l’attività svolta, e lavorare da remoto secondo quanto previsto dalle policy aziendali. Per informazioni sulla nostra protezione della privacy art13 L.679/2016 (GDPR) vai su  https://www.accenture.com/it-it/careers/privacy-policy Accenture garantisce le pari opportunità.


Show more

Title: Data Engineering Intern
Description:
Entrerai all'interno del team di Analytics & Development che si occupa delle attività di gestione e analisi dei dati. Collaborerai attivamente con il team per progetti legati all'integrazione ottimizzazione e all'arricchimento dei dati con un particolare focus sui big data. Utilizzerai strumenti e framework di Data Management che comprendono quelli per la modellazione l'ELT e Data Quality. Contribuirai nel definire e creare pipeline di dati affidabili e automatizzate per garantire un flusso costante di informazioni verso i nostri sistemi analitici.

Requirements



Laurea In Informatica o Ingegneria Informatica

Buone capacità analitiche di comprensione ed identificazione di dati

Propensione al teamwork e al problem solving

Ottime capacità relazionali

Ottima conoscenza della programmazione preferibilmente Python o SQL

Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office (in particolare Excel)

Inglese buono

ARECneprix è la nuova Asset & Solutions Structuring Company del Gruppo illimity specializzata nella gestione a 360° di crediti asset e aziende in difficoltà. Gestiamo crediti large mid e granulari oltre che asset immobiliari e strutturiamo operazioni finanziarie complesse coprendo l’intera catena del valore.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst & Data Governance Specialist
HTML:
Allitude S.p.a., società del Gruppo Bancario Cooperativo Cassa Centrale Banca specializzata in servizi di sviluppo software, outsourcing informatico e back-office per il Settore bancario, sta selezionando una figura di Data Analyst & Data Governance Specialist da inserire nel team Data Management & Governance, che gestisce i servizi di data modeling & design, Data Integration & interoperability, reference & master data, data quality e Data governance del Gruppo Bancario.


Sei la persona che stiamo cercando se apprezzi particolarmente il mondo del dato con le relative declinazioni nei contesti di data management. Se sei una persona che ha la conoscenza dei principali aspetti di data governance e che è pronta a declinarli in modo concreto e tramite l’opportuno trade off tra esigenze del business e necessità di mantenere la Data Platform governata e controllata. Sei la persona giusta se non hai paura di “sporcarti” le mani esplorando il dato e studiando le opportune soluzioni tecniche ai problemi che si presentano, ma riuscendo anche a mantenere una visione d’insieme per garantire che il governo del dato end to end sia opportunamente garantito.

Sei la persona giusta se ti trovi a tuo agio in un contesto in cui occorre consolidare le basi dati esistenti lavorando molto su database relazionali attraverso tecniche di modellazione “classica”, ma anche un contesto in cui si sta guardando alle nuove tecnologie, ai trend emergenti e a un’espansione degli analytics nei prossimi anni.


Di cosa ti occuperai?

  • comprendere a fondo l’architettura dati e relativi data flow;
  • comprendere a fondo il patrimonio informativo e le varie base dati del Gruppo acquisendone conoscenza a livello di contenuto e significato;
  • gestione e implementazione logiche di Master e Reference data management;
  • arricchimento e gestione logiche di metadata management (business glossary e dizionario tecnico);
  • comprendere i requisiti business relativi a richieste di dati e informazioni e tradurli in un linguaggio più tecnico in coerenza all’architettura dati;
  • supportare la realizzazione di progetti di change e di evolutive e collaborare anche alla gestione dei processi run;
  • redigere documentazione sul dato e sui processi di transformation dello stesso;
  • disegnare modelli dati, redigerne l’opportuna documentazione (e.g. diagrammi entity-relationship) e occuparsi di indirizzare la modellazione fisica degli stessi anche supervisionando un team di collaboratori;
  • gestire gli strumenti di data governance (data lineage, business glossary, data quality) acquisendone la competenza tecnica anche facendo leva su opportuni collaboratori.


Le tue caratteristiche principali:

  • laurea in discipline tecnico/scientifiche (informatica, ingegneria, matematica, fisica, statistica, …);
  • conoscenza approfondita dei databases relazionali (con focus particolare su tecnologie Oracle) e dei principali concetti: tabelle, viste, partizioni, indici, procedure, sinonimi;
  • conoscenza ed esperienza nell’esplorazione e analisi dei dati sui principali databases relazionali (e.g Oracle);
  • conoscenza avanzata di SQL e conoscenza basic di Python;
  • conoscenza di tool di versioning del codice (e.g. git) ed esperienza nell’utilizzo;
  • capacità avanzate nella modellazione dei dati (concettuale, logica e fisica), conoscenza delle forme normali, conoscenza dei diversi tipi di modello dati (esperienza con un qualche tool di data modelling);
  • conoscenza di fondamenti di data management (DAMA-DMBOK framework) e data governance (Strategie DG, Policies e Standard, Ruoli e organizzazione);
  • conoscenza di tecniche di ETL/ELT;
  • esperienze in ambito data governance: data quality, data lineage, data dictionary, etc ..;
  • esperienza di lavoro in ambito bancario/finanziario con conseguente conoscenza del dominio del dato trattato.


Costituiscono titolo preferenziale:

  • conoscenza ed esperienza su INFORMATICA (EDC, AXON, IDQ e Powercenter);
  • conoscenza ed esperienza di Python;
  • esperienza sul mondo Big Data e conoscenza basic di Spark.


Cosa troverai da noi:

Entrando in Allitude troverai un'azienda giovane e meritocratica che punta sulla crescita delle persone attraverso la formazione mirata allo sviluppo di hard e soft skill. I neoassunti hanno l’opportunità di partecipare a diverse iniziative volte a sviluppare un mindset innovativo e ad arricchire la conoscenza organizzativa e le competenze trasversali. Avrai la possibilità di lavorare in un’azienda che vanta un forte know how nell’ambito dei servizi bancari e tecnologici derivante dalle conoscenze pregresse delle aziende integrate. Potrai lavorare a progetti che puntano al miglioramento continuo e all'innovazione dei modelli di business delle nostre banche clienti.


I nostri benefit principali:

  • Smartworking
  • Assicurazione sanitaria
  • Fondo pensione
  • Buoni pasto da 8€ al giorno
  • Premi di risultato
  • Premi individuali una tantum
  • Agevolazioni bancarie
  • Welfare aziendale


Sede di lavoro: Milano, Trento, Palazzolo S/O (BS), Bologna (modalità ibrida)

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Description

We believe that clothes — and how you make them — can make a difference.

Since 1853, we’ve been passionate about innovation to meet people’s needs. We invented the first blue jean. And we reinvented khaki pants. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines for our manufacturing partners. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do.

A company doesn’t last 160 years by standing still. It endures by reinventing itself, striving to delight its consumers, winning in the marketplace, and by remaining true to its values. We employ more than 17,000 people around the world – supporting great brands, including Levi’s®, Dockers® and Denizen®. Our employees are committed to progress, authenticity and collaboration.

We're seeking for a motivated, data-driven Intern to join us at the Analytics team in Brussels for our Merchandising Planning and Inventory Management (MPIM) Department.

About The Job


Being point of contact for analytics and data inquiries
Creating data pipelines, dashboards and reports for use across Europe’s business
Cooperating with cross-functional partners to reach resolutions on data topics and build data products
Performing data wrangling and exploration in support of predictive modelling
Providing assistance to the extended team


About You


You have excellent analytical and communication/presentation skills
You hold a Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Engineering / Operational research / Econometrics
You have knowledge in SQL and/or R/Python
Self-motivated, problem solver, team player
Organized with meticulous attention to detail, ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
You are flexible and able to perform in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable learning new tools. (Dataiku, Tableau, Excel, SAS etc.)


Start date: Asap for 6 months renewable.

What We Offer


Great work experience in an international, energetic and fun environment
Great opportunity to work for the world’s number one denim brand
Great compensation


LOCATION

Zaventem, Belgium

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst/data engineer

Our organisation is gaining maturity at the level of data management, data engineering and BI reporting. An experienced Data Analyst/Data engineer is needed in this context.

Main focus will be to support business in the creation & documentation of various reporting and dashboards (Payment transactions, Accounting, KYC, Logistics...).

The analyst will also have the opportunity to take part in some business and functional analyses activities.




As a Data Analyst/Data Engineer (s)he should be able to :

Communicate efficiently with business departments to gather, understand and translate business needs into clear requirements.
Get a clear view of all the data sources and data available
Identify which data are required to build the expected extraction and reporting
Collect and integrate data and perform data preparation and transformations in a secure manner, in order to produce reusable key data sets
Use these key data sets to produce reportings and analysis for our internal customers as well as regulatory reportings
Create clear documentation on the data collection and transformations




For this, you should be able to :

Build reports via Salesforce reporting module and/or build dashboards via Tableau or Power BI.
Create insights and do storytelling
Export, merge and transform data with Power Query in case the data have not been integrated yet ; data security by design is key !
Ensure data quality by implementing controls on the imported and produced data.
Discover trends and insights that could bring value to the business.
Organise and document functionally implemented data integrations and reports




requirements

Fluently in Dutch, French & English




Required experience and knowledge Solid practical experience as a data engineer of at least 5 years is needed in the activities listed on the Function Description for which resource needs to take the lead.




You have a solid IT background and know all about data modelling, data documentation, data collecting and transforming and GDPR/data protection, building good data structures.

You've worked in a BI context previously (Accounting, Billing, payment transaction, terminal management environment), capturing and delivering data in a structured manner, with reusable key data sets. You have developed dashboards and reportings. You know do's and don'ts to build such deliverables.




Technical skills:

Good experience with IT activities (data models, API, data manipulation and transformation (doc included)
Excel (PowerPivot, PowerQuery...) ; Experience with market ETL/ELT tools is an advantage.
Salesforce reporting / Salesforce analytic Studio
Tableau dashboarding
Modelling technique (UML...)

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our data strategy and ensuring the successful implementation of our data initiatives. You will be responsible for analysing complex datasets, providing actionable insights and reports, and contributing to the development of our data platform. Your technical aptitude, curiosity, and autonomy will be essential as you collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.

As we embark on an exciting journey to create a robust data service, establish comprehensive data governance, and develop an innovative data platform!




Key Responsibilities

Analyse large datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends that support business objectives.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate data findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data engineers to design and implement data pipelines and ELT processes.
Participate in the creation and enhancement of our data platform, ensuring it meets the needs of various business units.
Provide technical expertise and support in data modelling, data integration, and data warehousing.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that drive business value.




About YOU

More than 3 years of significant experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a Startup or a software company.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R).
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, Power BI).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Curiosity and a passion for leveraging data to drive business outcomes.
Show more

  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R).
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, Power BI).
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Curiosity and a passion for leveraging data to drive business outcomes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2005 in Lisbon by three visionary entrepreneurs, MoOngy quickly became a leading group in Engineering and Information Technology (IT) across Europe and North Africa. Today, with a presence in 14 countries and more than 40 subsidiary companies, MoOngy employs over 9,500 talents who share a common passion for innovation and excellence.

The International Mobility Recruitment Department is dedicated to enhancing the mobility of IT professionals throughout Europe, facilitating the placement of talents in the various markets where it operates.




Position: Data Analyst

Location: Belgium

Type: Hybrid




Power Skills:

You are ready to work on global projects and contribute to digital transformation across various industries;
You wish to expand your career beyond national borders and you are ready for an European adventure;
You want to be part of a global community of innovators.




Technical and Soft Skills:




We are currently seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst with expertise in PowerBI, Python, and Data Bases (SQL). As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, creating visualizations, and generating insights to support data-driven decision making within our organization. You will work closely with stakeholders from various departments to understand their data needs and provide them with relevant analysis and reports. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, proficient in data manipulation and analysis, and has a strong understanding of database concepts and data visualization techniques.




Responsibilities

Conduct data analysis using various tools and techniques, including PowerBI, Python, and SQL
Develop and implement data models and databases to support data analysis and reporting
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide them with timely and accurate analysis and reports
Identify trends and patterns in data and provide insights and recommendations based on analysis
Cleanse and transform data to ensure accuracy and consistency
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize and communicate data findings
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and advancements in data analysis and visualization techniques




Requirements

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a similar industry
Proficiency in PowerBI, Python, and SQL for data analysis and visualization
Strong knowledge of database concepts and ability to work with large datasets
Familiarity with data modeling and database design principles
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with minimal supervision
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex ideas in a clear and concise manner
Fluent inEnglish is mandatory
Fluency in French (C2 level) or Dutch (C1 level) is mandatory
Candidates must be in Europe already




Advantages of joining MoOngy:

International Mobility: Access to a dedicated international mobility department with personalized relocation programs to facilitate your move to a new country.

Career Development: Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies in different countries and various sectors.

Continuous Learning: Access to ongoing and free training and career-oriented certifications.

Personal Growth: Exchange of ideas and best practices among professionals across Europe, fostering creativity and innovation in IT.

Global Citizen in the World of Technology: Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.




@MoOngy Group we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills needed for the position are welcome!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join Revpanda.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data related to revenue, client, player behavior, registrations, FTD (First-Time Depositors), payback, and marketing efforts. Your insights will support strategic decisions and optimize our marketing and operational strategies.







Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Analysis: Gather, process, and analyze data from various sources, including player behavior, registration, FTD, payback, and marketing and financial campaigns.
Reporting & Dashboards: Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
Insights & Recommendations: Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in the data, providing actionable insights and recommendations to improve business outcomes.
Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, product development, and operational teams to understand their data needs and deliver relevant insights.
Market Analysis: Conduct market and competitor analysis to identify opportunities for growth and optimization.
Data Integrity: Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and validation processes.
Visualization: Create clear and effective data visualizations to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.







Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the iGaming, digital marketing, or related industries.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as SQL, Excel, Looker Studio, Power BI, or similar.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization techniques.
Familiarity with digital marketing metrics and iGaming industry trends.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics).
Experience with A/B testing and data-driven experimentation.




What we offer:

Friendly and supportive colleagues
Diverse opportunities for professional growth and career development
Possibility to take part in international conferences and online courses
Competitive salary
Birthday day off
"Refer a friend" bonus
Corporate events
LinkedIn Learning complimentary access

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a global European HQ'd biotech that has grown 90% in the past two years and has seen huge success with recent launches - their stocks/shares have absolutely rocketed as a result.




They are looking for a Subject Matter Expert (Data Analytics) to join their Business Information Systems team. Within this role you will be working in close collaboration with Quality and Regulatory teams, understanding, anticipating and influencing the demand for services and translating requirements into efficient and harmonised solutions. You would be working with Snowflake, Veeva and Matilion so need strong experience with these tools/systems.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.




Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions. 




As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3 years of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

Title: Deals Data Analyst
Description:
Line of Service

Advisory

Industry/Sector

Not Applicable

Specialism

Data Analytics

Management Level

Associate

Job Description & Summary

Leading with heart, living by values

PwC Advisory is a garden of possibilities, and you’re reaping the rewards. Where you want to make an impact is always up to you. With the full support of our Advisory teams, you’ll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you’ll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that’s making a difference.

Are you passionate about Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) and the data that drives business decisions? Do you want to transform business data into meaningful insights? If so, PwC's Deal Analytics team is the place for you!

In the dynamic world of M&A, data is a vital source of value creation. However, many companies struggle to leverage it effectively. This is where PwC’s Deal Analytics team excels. We harness data to provide critical insights for buyers and sellers, enhancing their understanding of historical performance and uncovering new opportunities. As a data analyst, you will be at the heart of that, engaging in a wide array of tasks:

What you will learn and do


Execute on exciting projects:
Harness the power of data and analytics to create (or break) a compelling story around a target business;
Unlock value potential after a deal;
Liaise with clients, advisors and/or other PwC teams to provide robust, data-driven insights (e.g. into business and value drivers)
Work across the entire data-lifecycle:
Extract, transform and load (ETL) client and alternative data using a variety of tools;
Automate manual processes to boost efficiency.
Utilize tools like Alteryx, R, or Python to conduct complex analyses
Create insightful visualizations using e.g. Power BI
Help our Deals Analytics team to further grow:
Coordinate our intern(s) and/or remote teams;
Contribute to development of new services; by building Proof-of-Concept solutions using new technology and techniques;
Be a digital accelerator for the broader Deals practice


Who You Are, What You’re Like


Earned a degree in a technology-related program, mathematics, statistics, civil or business engineering.
Worked as a data analyst/ data scientist/data engineer or BI-consultant/developer in a similar consulting environment with at least 1 year of relevant experience.
Possess an analytical mind with strong business acumen.
Skilled in communicating complex analyses effectively to diverse audiences.
Fluency in English; ideally also in Dutch and/or French.
Knowledgeable in basic financial, accounting, and commercial principles.
Experience in working a range of data tools like:
Visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau or equivalent;
ETL-tools such as Alteryx or equivalent;
R, Python or other scripting tools (with advanced analytical capabilities);
Excel, Power Tools


Life at PwC Belgium

Our culture and workplace are something we’re proud of. Here’s a sneak peek at some of the benefits you can look forward to.


Flexibility: flexible working hours so you can decide your most effective working pattern.
Infinite learning and growing: broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.
Rewards that matter to you: a flexible rewards plan gives you access to a wide range of benefits so you can make the choices that best fit your personal circumstances and lifestyle.
Diversity & inclusion: we believe that diversity makes PwC stronger. It helps us solve important problems and deliver added value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be the best versions of themselves. We organise various D&I initiatives, including an active employee-led Employee Resource Group (ERG) community, comprising 9 diversity groups with over 200 PwC employees aiming to make an impact within and beyond PwC.
A sustainable mobility offer: we offer a comprehensive mobility budget with a wide range of options (hybrid and electric cars, bike leasing, mobility card or loan reimbursement).
Well-being: an extensive health and well-being programme that includes access to professional sport coaching, individual sessions, sports communities and mental health resources. We encourage a healthy lifestyle with regular wellness challenges and various catering options at our cafeteria.
Team events such as Last Friday Drinks, quarterly themed parties, team-building days and celebrations, as well as time spent on community days and charity activities.
International PwC network: broad access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms.
Supporting you in every phase of your life, including family friendly work schemes.


Looking for a career where you’ll really make a difference? Then we look forward to meeting you!

Degrees/Field of Study required:

Degrees/Field of Study preferred:

Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)

Required Skills

Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Engineering

Optional Skills

Travel Requirements

Not Specified

No

Title: Sports Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and inquisitive Business Analyst with strong SQL knowledge and previous experience in gaming with heavy focus on sport. Must have experience with reporting tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker. The ideal candidate will demonstrate curiosity, attention to detail, analytical thinking, and strong collaboration skills. Python skills are a plus for this role.

The candidate will work closely with our casino team to create dashboards and produce meaningful insights through data analysis.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the casino team to understand their business objectives, define key performance indicators (KPIs), and prioritize dashboard enhancements.
Develop and maintain SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from various databases and sources.
Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker, or similar reporting tools.
Validate data integrity, ensure data accuracy, and provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
Maintain and optimize existing dashboards and reports, in addition to creating new ones.




Requirements:

Experience in the gaming industry, particularly within Casino and Sports.
Strong SQL skills for querying and manipulating databases.
Experience in data analytics and visualization tools, such as Tableau or PowerBI.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with exceptional attention to detail.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills.
Python or any other Programming Language skills are a plus.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
In this role, you will be in charge of the creation and maintenance of KPI’s, reporting and dashboards, facilitating the steering of the Infrastructure activities, as well as of detailed data analysis and the presentation of the corresponding quantitative and qualitative conclusions.




Your responsibilities:

Identify and inventorize the data sources for the Infrastructure department, validate the data consistency and identity the necessary and potential improvements
Identify and define the KPI’s to be measured based on the requests and needs of the Teams within the Infrastructure department, the operational processes and own expertise within the domain.
Develop the steering KPI’s and create / manage dashboards which integrate those KPI’s and enable an efficient monitoring and steering of the Infrastructure dep. activities, and be proactive / force of proposal on new reporting perspectives and data cross-referencing to provide the Infrastructure dep. with alternative view on performance
Analyze the trend evolutions through dashboards as well as performing ‘ad hoc’ analyses on specific topics, potentially by compiling / cross-referencing Infrastructure data with other data sources.
Synthesize and present the dashboards and the results of specific analyses together with the corresponding quantitative and qualitative conclusions in a clear manner adapted to the audience.
Reporting project management: planning creation and management, drive the different project phases through collaboration with internal / external stakeholders & experts, communication of the progress / challenges / mitigations, and internal / external quality control after the move to production.
Contribute to transversal projects touching Infrastructure dep. as expert / interface of Infrastructure data management and reporting to ensure the consideration of Infrastructure dep.’s needs and the respect for Infrastructure dep.’s essential KPI’s.




Your profile:

University degree
3 years of experience in a similar position
Dashboarding / reporting expertise
Data analysis and data management expertise
Mastery of IT tools linked to data extraction, data manipulation and data analysis
Interest in numbers (reports and KPIs), proactivity, excellent communication skills
Fluent French and a good level of English




What we offer:

A dynamic working environment where you have every opportunity for personal development. Moreover, you can look forward to the following compensation and benefits package: a market competitive salary, a company car, performance bonus, meal vouchers, 32 holidays per year, pension provision, life assurance and accident cover, and medical insurance.




Inspired? Then we would like to hear from you! If there’s a match in the making, we’ll invite you for a first interview.
