  • Develop the steering KPI’s and create / manage dashboards which integrate those KPI’s and enable an efficient monitoring and steering of the Infrastructure dep. activities, and be proactive / force of proposal on new reporting perspectives and data cross-referencing to provide the Infrastructure dep. with alternative view on performance
  • Analyze the trend evolutions through dashboards as well as performing ‘ad hoc’ analyses on specific topics, potentially by compiling / cross-referencing Infrastructure data with other data sources.
  • Synthesize and present the dashboards and the results of specific analyses together with the corresponding quantitative and qualitative conclusions in a clear manner adapted to the audience.
  • Reporting project management: planning creation and management, drive the different project phases through collaboration with internal / external stakeholders & experts, communication of the progress / challenges / mitigations, and internal / external quality control after the move to production.
  • Contribute to transversal projects touching Infrastructure dep. as expert / interface of Infrastructure data management and reporting to ensure the consideration of Infrastructure dep.’s needs and the respect for Infrastructure dep.’s essential KPI’s.


Your profile:

  • University degree
  • 3 years of experience in a similar position
  • Dashboarding / reporting expertise
  • Data analysis and data management expertise
  • Mastery of IT tools linked to data extraction, data manipulation and data analysis
  • Interest in numbers (reports and KPIs), proactivity, excellent communication skills
  • Fluent French and a good level of English


What we offer:

A dynamic working environment where you have every opportunity for personal development. Moreover, you can look forward to the following compensation and benefits package: a market competitive salary, a company car, performance bonus, meal vouchers, 32 holidays per year, pension provision, life assurance and accident cover, and medical insurance.


Inspired? Then we would like to hear from you! If there’s a match in the making, we’ll invite you for a first interview.

Title: Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
You’ll be part of the Strategy team, working closely with senior management and focusing on the business lines of Telenet, BASE, and Tadaam for both segments: a) residential and b) SOHO (small office home office).




Here are some key points about the role:

Your tasks as a Data & Insights Analyst

Identify & Prioritize Insights: Work with business unit’s facilitators and senior management to determine key insights and reporting needs.
Build & Communicate Dashboards: Create and share KPI dashboards that map business unit’s performance.
Recommend Improvements: Proactively suggest areas for performance enhancement.
Collaborate on Deep Dives: Work with Data & Insights specialists to synthesize complex insights into actionable recommendations.
Monitor Business Planning: Assist with budget and forecast updates, creating insights with business stakeholders.
Support Colleagues: Help business colleagues with self-service tools.




What we have to offer

Strategic Department: Gain a broad view of strategic projects and P&Ls.
Personal Development: Opportunities for internal mobility and extensive learning opportunities. Along with chance to press the pause button after a while or take another path.
Work-Life Balance: A supportive environment that adapts to your needs.
Financial incentives: A competitive gross monthly salary that we complement with a lot of fringe benefits (meal vouchers, cell phone, option for a car, hospitalization insurance, telephone subscription, discounts on Telenet products, possibility to work from home,.).

It’s a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you can grow and make a significant impact. Does this role align with what you’re looking for in your next career move?




Our ideal D&I Analyst has …

Minimum 2-3 years' experience as a data or business analyst or similar roles
Master's degree in an economic, technical or economic field (Commercial Engineering, Applied Economics, Computer Science, Digital...) or similar experience
Excellent presentation and storytelling skills. We value different points of view.
Strong analytical & result oriented skills
Can naturally assume problem solving thinking and has great impact on decision makers
Knowledge and experience in telecom, media or consulting or similar industries is a plus




Apply? Good idea!

Fancy a job with content and variety? Become D&I Analyst at Telenet. Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wil jij een cruciale rol spelen in het optimaliseren van data-gedreven besluitvorming binnen BMW Financial Services ? Als Data Analyst ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het implementeren van geavanceerde data- en informatiemanagement oplossingen. Je visualiseert data met krachtige tools, genereert waardevolle inzichten en ondersteunt de business bij het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen.




Met jouw sterke analytische vaardigheden, technische kennis en communicatieve talent, ben jij de ideale kandidaat om ons team te versterken. Solliciteer nu en maak het verschil!




Wat doe je als Data Analyst?

Je implementeert geavanceerde data- en informatiemanagement oplossingen, met als doel het gebruik van rapportages, informatie en data in het hele bedrijf te optimaliseren.
Je stemt de implementatie van nieuwe bedrijfsoplosssing af met interne stakeholders.
Je waarborgt de kwaliteit van de data d.m.v. data testings en een optimaal data quality beleid.
Je visualiseert data met krachtige tools als Tableau (of Power BI).
Je zorgt voor waardevolle zakelijke inzichten door data-analyse en -modellering.
Je ondersteunt de organisatie bij het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen.
Je treedt op als oplossingsarchitect op het gebied van interactieve rapportage en analyse.
Je maakt gebruik van bestaande systemen en functionaliteiten en stimuleert tegelijkertijd verdere innovatie.
Je ondersteunt de continue ontwikkeling van het rapportage- en analyselandschap en helpt bij de toepassing van AI en Machine Learning.




Waarmee kan je ons team versterken?

Je beschikt over sterke organisatorische, analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je kan je bevindingen en technische concepten op een vlotte, effectieve manier presenteren en overbrengen.
Je bent leergierig en vindt het belangrijk om nieuwe informatie en vaardigheden te leren, op te nemen en toe te passen.
Je hebt ervaring opgebouwd in data-analyse en data quality management.
Kennis van Microsoft Office-toepassingen.
Kennis van SQL en Tableau (of Power BI).
Kennis van DW-concepten, -processen en -methodologie.
Kennis van collaboration tools zoals Confluence en Agile tools zoals Jira
Je bent vloeiend in het Nederlands en het Engels, zowel gesproken als geschreven.




What's in it for you?

Als je bij ons opstart, kom je terecht bij een premium speler met een internationaal en innovatief karakter. We zetten sterk in op doorgroeimogelijkheden en helpen onze werknemers mee te groeien met onze onderneming door een aangepast opleidingsaanbod te voorzien.




We kiezen voor een hybride, flexibele manier van werken, waarbij we kantoordagen afwisselen met thuiswerkdagen. Zo heb je de mogelijkheid als fulltime medewerker om twee dagen per week van thuis uit te werken.




Daarnaast bieden wij een aantrekkelijk én gepersonaliseerd loonpakket aan dankzij ons Flex Income Plan. Hierin bepaal je zelf welke loonelementen je wenst op te nemen, zoals bijvoorbeeld een lease-auto of -fiets, extra vakantiedagen, multimedia... Verder geniet je van tal van extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. maaltijdcheques, een hospitalisatieverzekering en een groepsverzekering.

Show more

Title: EV Data Analyst Business Intelligence Specialist (H/F/X)
Description:
Profil du candidat


Langues : Français Néerlandais. L'anglais est un plus.
Master académique ou équivalent par l'expérience professionnelle (science des données, statistiques, ingénierie, informatique).
Solide expérience analytique/mathématique avec une grande attention aux détails.
Expérience en gestion/analyse/science des données.
Résolveur de problèmes indépendant ; agile et pragmatique.
Solides compétences organisationnelles. Bonne capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois.
Capacité à communiquer clairement des informations sur les données (y compris la capacité à structurer des présentations de gestion).
Ne pas avoir peur de plonger dans les modèles statistiques, la modélisation prédictive, les algorithmes de classification, les arbres de décision, le clustering, etc.
Affinité avec les opérations commerciales.
Volonté d'évoluer dans un environnement en constante évolution.



Activités

Coordonner la collecte, l'agrégation, le traitement, l'analyse et le support des données :


Construire, exploiter et maintenir la plateforme/environnement Power BI (et sa connexion à l'entrepôt de données de TotalEnergies).
Concevoir et créer des tableaux de bord d'analyse de données et des modèles statistiques pour aider l'équipe EV à gérer les ventes, les opérations, le sourcing, les projets, etc.
Développer des modèles de prévision et d'analyse de localisation pour l'expansion du réseau de recharge (semi)public.
Développer et soutenir l'échange de données vers et depuis les applications/outils EV et les systèmes ERP pertinents (externes).
Agir en tant que contributeur clé de l'équipe Solutions pour les solutions innovantes axées sur les données (par exemple, la recharge intelligente, la maintenance prédictive, etc.)
Agir en tant qu'expert de première ligne en matière d'analyse de données et d'outils pour l'équipe chargée de la recharge des véhicules électriques.
Collecte, agrégation, synthèse et intégration des données externes du marché des VE



Responsable des rapports, du soutien au contrôle de gestion et de la fourniture de données à des tiers :


Fournisseur clé de données sur le réseau de recharge (performance et déploiement) à la direction pour la prise de décisions stratégiques.
Mise en place, suivi et enrichissement des données de performance clés.
Collaborer avec l'équipe des opérations pour identifier les problèmes opérationnels.
Collaborer avec l'équipe de contrôle de gestion pour structurer les résultats à partager avec la direction.
Collaborer avec l'équipe Solutions pour les développements matériels et logiciels.
Assurer la liaison avec les fournisseurs informatiques internes et externes et le département informatique de TotalEnergies sur les projets de données et signaler les déviations et les opportunités.
Suivre et étudier activement les tendances du marché des VE et partager les informations pertinentes avec l'organisation et la direction.



Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies Charging Solutions Belgium est une filiale essentielle pour soutenir TotalEnergies dans son engagement pour une meilleure énergie. Ce jeune département se développe rapidement pour répondre à l'énorme transition en cours, et est donc en constante évolution. TSCB est donc la recherche d’un.e :

EV Data Analyst Business Intelligence Specialist (H/F/X)

EV Data Analyst Business Intelligence Specialist (H/F/X)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This is a remote position.

Freelance job for a French / Duch speaking Data Analyst in Belgium. 12 month contract

Job Overview: We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with proficiency in SAS and Azure to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to leverage data to inform business decisions. This role involves working with cross-functional teams to collect, process, and analyze data, ensuring accuracy and integrity, and developing insights that drive strategic initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:


Extract, clean, and analyze large datasets using SAS.
Develop, implement, and maintain data models, reports, and dashboards in Azure.
Collaborate with business units to identify data needs and provide actionable insights.
Ensure data integrity and consistency across various data sources.
Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling to support business objectives.
Create and maintain documentation for data processes, analysis methodologies, and reporting.
Support ad-hoc data requests and projects as needed.
Continuously improve data collection and analysis processes.


Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Strong proficiency in SAS for data manipulation, analysis, and reporting.
Experience with Azure data services (Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Azure Databricks, etc.).
Solid understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
Proficiency in SQL for querying databases.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


Master’s degree in a related field.
Experience with additional programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques.
Certification in SAS and/or Azure.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
De voorbije 2 jaar hebben we met Catcoon een indrukwekkende groei doorgemaakt en scherpte we onze dienstverlening aan, met een speciale focus op sectoren waar we écht het verschil maken: HR, Gezondheidszorg, de Publieke sector en Energie.




Onze ambitie is om te blijven groeien en daarom zoeken we een gedreven Data Analyst om samen met onze klanten datagestuurde besluitvorming te stimuleren en hen te helpen transformeren richting een data gedreven organisatie. Je werkt samen met verschillende rollen in het datadomein en het is aan jou om ervoor te zorgen dat data wordt omgezet in verstaanbare inzichten die de bedrijfsstrategie ondersteunen.




Heb je zin om een dosis empathie en rationeel gezond verstand te combineren met data gedreven inzichten en processen? Ben jij iemand die analytische vaardigheden combineert met zakelijk inzicht, de kracht van data begrijpt en kan zorgen voor de juiste governance?




Dan leren we je graag kennen.




Wat ga je doen?

Je wordt ingezet als Data & Analytics consultant voor één van onze klanten binnen onze sector (HR, Gezondheidszorg, de Publieke sector of Energie)
Je analyseert complexe datasets om bruikbare inzichten te genereren die de strategische doelen van de klant ondersteunen.
Je helpt bij het opzetten van een Data & Analytics groeipad van reactieve analyses naar voorspellende analyses.
Je gebruikt geavanceerde analytische technieken en tools om patronen te identificeren, voorspellingen te doen en aanbevelingen te geven.
Je werkt nauw samen met klantteams om data-analyse initiatieven te leiden en de implementatie van data gestuurde besluitvormingsprocessen te ondersteunen.
Je presenteert en visualiseert gegevens op een manier die begrijpelijk en overtuigend is voor zowel technische als niet-technische stakeholders.
Je verzamelt, reinigt en organiseert data uit verschillende bronnen om inzichten te creëren voor de klanten.
Je implementeert het data governance beleid en procedures om datakwaliteit, data-integriteit en data-veiligheid te waarborgen bij de klant. Je kan hier ook kritisch naar kijken en advies over geven.
Je blijft op de hoogte van de nieuwste trends en ontwikkelingen in data science, machine learning, big data technologieën en data governance.

 

Wat verwachten we van je?

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring in Data-analyse of Business Intelligence
Je hebt bij voorkeur minstens 1 jaar ervaring in 1 van onze sectoren (HR, Gezondheidszorg, de Publieke sector of Energie)
Je bent gepassioneerd door data en hebt diepgaande kennis van analytische methoden, statistische modellen en data governance principes.
Je hebt ervaring met SQL, Python, R of andere data-analyse tools en platforms.
Je hebt ervaring met het visualiseren van data met tools als Tableau, Power BI, Qklik of vergelijkbare software.
Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en kunt complexe ideeën duidelijk en effectief communiceren aan een gevarieerd publiek.
Je bent kritisch en weet wanneer te luisteren, wanneer terug te duwen en wanneer te leiden.
Je bent nieuwsgierig, innovatief en hebt een sterk probleemoplossend vermogen.




Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Een competitief loon in functie van jouw ervaring
Een firmawagen
Alles wat je nodig hebt om jouw job uit te oefenen, zowel thuis als op kantoor
Vrijheid en ruimte voor eigen ideeën en initiatief
De optie om aan persoonlijke cases te werken met een focus op onderzoek en innovatie
Interne opleidingen en de mogelijkheid om te groeien in een ervaren team
Sfeervol hoofdkantoor in een oude opslagplaats nabij Park Spoor Noord te Antwerpen (www.hoi.be)
Leuke collega’s, teamsfeer en -events!
Extralegale voordelen zoals hospitalisatieverzekering, groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en ecocheques




Iets voor jou?

Stuur ons je inspirerende motivatiebrief en CV naar info@catcoon.be en bouw mee aan een mooiere digitale wereld.

Show more
HTML:
De voorbije 2 jaar hebben we met Catcoon een indrukwekkende groei doorgemaakt en scherpte we onze dienstverlening aan, met een speciale focus op sectoren waar we écht het verschil maken: HR, Gezondheidszorg, de Publieke sector en Energie.


Onze ambitie is om te blijven groeien en daarom zoeken we een gedreven Data Analyst om samen met onze klanten datagestuurde besluitvorming te stimuleren en hen te helpen transformeren richting een data gedreven organisatie. Je werkt samen met verschillende rollen in het datadomein en het is aan jou om ervoor te zorgen dat data wordt omgezet in verstaanbare inzichten die de bedrijfsstrategie ondersteunen.


Heb je zin om een dosis empathie en rationeel gezond verstand te combineren met data gedreven inzichten en processen? Ben jij iemand die analytische vaardigheden combineert met zakelijk inzicht, de kracht van data begrijpt en kan zorgen voor de juiste governance?


Dan leren we je graag kennen.


Wat ga je doen?

  • Je wordt ingezet als Data & Analytics consultant voor één van onze klanten binnen onze sector (HR, Gezondheidszorg, de Publieke sector of Energie)
  • Je analyseert complexe datasets om bruikbare inzichten te genereren die de strategische doelen van de klant ondersteunen.
  • Je helpt bij het opzetten van een Data & Analytics groeipad van reactieve analyses naar voorspellende analyses.
  • Je gebruikt geavanceerde analytische technieken en tools om patronen te identificeren, voorspellingen te doen en aanbevelingen te geven.
  • Je werkt nauw samen met klantteams om data-analyse initiatieven te leiden en de implementatie van data gestuurde besluitvormingsprocessen te ondersteunen.
  • Je presenteert en visualiseert gegevens op een manier die begrijpelijk en overtuigend is voor zowel technische als niet-technische stakeholders.
  • Je verzamelt, reinigt en organiseert data uit verschillende bronnen om inzichten te creëren voor de klanten.
  • Je implementeert het data governance beleid en procedures om datakwaliteit, data-integriteit en data-veiligheid te waarborgen bij de klant. Je kan hier ook kritisch naar kijken en advies over geven.
  • Je blijft op de hoogte van de nieuwste trends en ontwikkelingen in data science, machine learning, big data technologieën en data governance.

 

Wat verwachten we van je?

  • Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring in Data-analyse of Business Intelligence
  • Je hebt bij voorkeur minstens 1 jaar ervaring in 1 van onze sectoren (HR, Gezondheidszorg, de Publieke sector of Energie)
  • Je bent gepassioneerd door data en hebt diepgaande kennis van analytische methoden, statistische modellen en data governance principes.
  • Je hebt ervaring met SQL, Python, R of andere data-analyse tools en platforms.
  • Je hebt ervaring met het visualiseren van data met tools als Tableau, Power BI, Qklik of vergelijkbare software.
  • Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en kunt complexe ideeën duidelijk en effectief communiceren aan een gevarieerd publiek.
  • Je bent kritisch en weet wanneer te luisteren, wanneer terug te duwen en wanneer te leiden.
  • Je bent nieuwsgierig, innovatief en hebt een sterk probleemoplossend vermogen.


Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

  • Een competitief loon in functie van jouw ervaring
  • Een firmawagen
  • Alles wat je nodig hebt om jouw job uit te oefenen, zowel thuis als op kantoor
  • Vrijheid en ruimte voor eigen ideeën en initiatief
  • De optie om aan persoonlijke cases te werken met een focus op onderzoek en innovatie
  • Interne opleidingen en de mogelijkheid om te groeien in een ervaren team
  • Sfeervol hoofdkantoor in een oude opslagplaats nabij Park Spoor Noord te Antwerpen (www.hoi.be)
  • Leuke collega’s, teamsfeer en -events!
  • Extralegale voordelen zoals hospitalisatieverzekering, groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en ecocheques


Iets voor jou?

Stuur ons je inspirerende motivatiebrief en CV naar info@catcoon.be en bouw mee aan een mooiere digitale wereld.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!




A little bit about us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.




How you will make a difference:




Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team.
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers.
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok.
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes.
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards.




Requirements




Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Proactive attitude and results-oriented.




Perks of being one of us




Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks




Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.




Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Azure Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future.

With 25 years’ experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you’ll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, business consultants, solution architects, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to work with the world’s leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

If you like these keywords, you’ll love this role:

#data #azure #PowerBI #Reporting #Dashboarding #DataWarehouse #DataMart #StarSchema

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You’re a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.


Qualifications

For this position, we’re looking for all seniority levels. 

[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake…)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You’re ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You’re either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203



If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don’t worry. Just apply. Together we’ll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.

Our promises to you

As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.


Additional Information

#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
  3. Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
  4. Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
  5. Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.

  7. Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
  8. Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
  9. Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: Data Analyst – Data Management & Analytics
Description:
Capco – The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We are dedicated to fully supporting our clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking, Capital Markets, Finance Risk & Compliance, Insurance, and Wealth and Investment Management. Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com

Let’s Talk About You

You want to Own Your Career. You’re serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you’re ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Data analyst Consultant.

Let’s Get Down To Business

We are looking for a data Consultant to join our Data team.

Responsibilities


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Show Us What You’ve Got

It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience:


Professional experience of 2-8 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch and excellent knowledge of English


Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

Now Take the Next Step

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.

What Do We Offer


An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a green mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture


Show more
HTML:
Capco – The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We are dedicated to fully supporting our clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking, Capital Markets, Finance Risk & Compliance, Insurance, and Wealth and Investment Management. Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com

Let’s Talk About You

You want to Own Your Career. You’re serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you’re ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Data analyst Consultant.

Let’s Get Down To Business

We are looking for a data Consultant to join our Data team.

Responsibilities

  • Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
  • Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
  • Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
  • Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
  • Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
  • Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
  • Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis

Show Us What You’ve Got

It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience:

  • Professional experience of 2-8 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
  • Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
  • Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
  • Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
  • Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
  • You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
  • Fluency in French or Dutch and excellent knowledge of English

Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

Now Take the Next Step

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.

What Do We Offer

  • An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a green mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
  • Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts
  • A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
  • A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
  • A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
  • A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Je komt terecht in de marketing tribe bij Telenet Business, de dynamische en groeiende B2B-circle binnen de Telenet groep. Nu B2B steeds meer datagedreven wordt, speel jij een cruciale rol in het overnemen van deze mindset en het verschaffen van de juiste inzichten. Je maakt deel uit van een klein dynamisch team dat verantwoordelijk is voor marketing intelligence, marketing automation, digital marketing en performance. De data analist werkt zeer nauw samen met de marketing collega's, zijn data analist collega's, data scientists maar ook met sales, solutions experts, business analisten.

Jouw rol als data analist


Als data analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het beheersen van commerciële data, zorg je ervoor dat deze door jou of andere collega's wordt opgeschoond en ondersteun je stakeholders met interessante business inzichten. Als je houdt van een verscheidenheid aan dataprojecten, in een complex datalandschap en om samen te werken met een veelheid aan stakeholders, dan ben jij onze persoon!
Je verzamelt, cleaned en valideert de gegevens die je nodig hebt uit verschillende bronnen.
Stelt klantenlijsten op, combineert relevante klant- en productgegevens om leadgeneratieacties, migraties en marketingacties voor te bereiden.
Zorg ervoor dat we de meest optimale gegevenskwaliteit in onze contacten hebben
Bepaal gegevensverbeteringen om ervoor te zorgen dat we de gegevenskwaliteit op peil houden en het beste halen uit de gegevens die we verzamelen
Stuur het commerciële team aan door bedrijfsinzichten en meer specifieke segmentinzichten te bieden. Ondersteun de business door nieuwe kansen te definiëren op basis van diepgaande data-analyse, suggesties om de prestaties te verbeteren, etc.
Creëer in Qlik nieuwe rapporten ter ondersteuning van zakelijke inzichten voor commerciële sturing.
Zorg ervoor dat we voldoen aan het GDPR-beleid van Telenet met betrekking tot B2B-klantgegevens.


We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analist met de volgende vaardigheden


Data-driven mindset met het vermogen om de juiste inhoudelijke KPI's vast te stellen en deze op te volgen.
Strong analytical and data skills, met kennis van Excel, SQL, SPSS en/of rapportageplatform. Ervaring met QlikSense is een voordeel.
Op je gemak zijn in een complexe omgeving met meerdere te beheren tools/bronnen
Samenwerken met een veelheid aan stakeholders van verschillende afdelingen binnen B2B
Goede presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden, zeker naar niet-data gedreven collega's
Een probleemoplossende en resultaatgerichte mindset
Uitstekende communicatie- en samenwerkingsvaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels, Frans is een pré.
Ervaring van minimaal 3-5 jaar als data/business/CRM-analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.


Wat kun je van ons verwachten?


Je komt terecht bij een bedrijf en een team die veel in je investeren en je werkomgeving waar mogelijk aanpassen aan je behoeften. We willen dat je jezelf ontwikkelt en zorgen tegelijkertijd voor een goede balans tussen werk en privé.
Je krijgt alle kansen om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden, maar geven je ook de kans om desgewenst op de pauzeknop te drukken of een heel ander pad in te slaan.
Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten zult boeken en je stempel zult drukken.
Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals kortingen op Telenet producten, maaltijdcheques, ... .
Een geweldig team van collega's die net zo gepassioneerd zijn als jij.
Je komt te werken in een geweldige moderne werkplek op Telenet HQ in Mechelen met de mogelijkheid om tot drie dagen per week thuis te werken
Show more

Title: Reporting & Data Analyst
Description:
Als Reporting & Data Analyst maak je deel uit van een dynamisch team dat zich focust op analyse en rapportering voor Indirecte Aankopen binnen Colruyt Group Technics. Jouw bijdrage speelt een belangrijke rol bij besluitvormingsprocessen en het bevorderen van de groei van het bedrijf. Een job met veel impact!




Een greep uit jouw takenpakket:

Als Reporting & Data Analyst binnen Colruyt Group Technics ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en rapporteren van gegevens die cruciaal zijn voor onze bedrijfsvoering. Hiervoor ontwikkel, onderhoud en optimaliseer je periodieke rapportages en dashboards met behulp van Power BI.
Je analyseert hierbij data om trends, patronen en inzichten te ontdekken, maar ook knelpunten en verbeterpunten te vinden. Vanuit jouw inzichten doe je voorstellen voor datagedreven verbeteringen en strategische initiatieven.
Je werkt samen met verschillende interne stakeholders om hun noden en rapportagebehoeften te begrijpen en te vervullen.
Je schrijft werkmethodes uit, stelt gedetailleerde opleidingsmappen op ifv. de opgestelde rapporteringen en geeft trainingen aan medewerkers om hen te ondersteunen bij het gebruik van rapportages en data-analysetools.
Je werkt nauw samen met jouw team om gegevensgestuurde oplossingen te ontwikkelen en te implementeren.
Je waakt over de datakwaliteit binnen de verschillende systemen aan de hand van rapporteringen en draagt op die manier actief bij aan de continue verbetering van dataverzamelings- en analyseprocessen.

Je werkt in Halle en kunt tot 2 dagen per week thuiswerken of in een van onze regionale kantoren (Mechelen, Haasrode, Zwijnaarde, …).




Profiel




Ervaring – Je hebt minstens een bachelordiploma in een relevante studierichting zoals Data Science, Statistiek, Wiskunde, … en ervaring met het werken in complexe spreadsheets in Excel. Basiskennis van SAP is een pluspunt.
Analytisch vermogen – Je bent analytisch en kunt complexe informatie vertalen naar begrijpelijke inzichten zonder de details uit het oog te verliezen.
Teamplayer – Je werkt in een multidisciplinair team, je haalt energie uit samenwerken om de beste resultaten te halen.
Initiatief – Je bent gedreven en pakt je werk zelf vast om op een efficiënte manier je doel te bereiken. Zie je dat iets beter kan? Dan ga je daar mee aan de slag.
Communicatie - Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe gegevens eenvoudig uit te leggen.
Talenkennis – Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en Frans en kunt informatie vlot overbrengen aan je collega’s en stakeholders.




Wij bieden




Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket, gecombineerd met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, winstdeelname en een hospitalisatieverzekering.
Opleidingen en leertrajecten – Wij voorzien opleidingen die aansluiten bij je ervaring en behoeften. Je krijgt alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontplooien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak.
Eigen verantwoordelijkheden - We geven je de kans om je eigen verantwoordelijkheden op te nemen, maar ook om je eigen ideeën en initiatieven mee vorm te geven.
Werkzekerheid – Colruyt Group is een stabiel bedrijf in volle groei met ruim 32.000 medewerkers. Bij ons kan je dus rekenen op werkzekerheid én een mooie toekomst!
Plezant werken – Een hecht en dynamisch team staat te popelen om jou te leren kennen. Je staat er niet alleen voor, voor vragen kan je altijd bij hen terecht.




Je gaat aan de slag bij Colruyt Group Technics, onze interne technische dienst. We ontwerpen, (ver)bouwen en onderhouden alle winkels, distributiecentra, DATS 24-tankstations, voertuigen en installaties van Colruyt Group. Of je nu technieker, administratief medewerker of architect bent, je merkt meteen de impact van je werk.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

We are seeking an entry-level Data Analyst to join our team at Amaris Consulting in Brussels, Belgium. In this role, you will be responsible for interpreting data and turning it into information which can offer ways to improve a business, thus affecting business decisions. You will gather information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends.

🔥Your Responsibilities:



Analyze large datasets while managing and coordinating with different stakeholders.
Perform regular quality control checks on data, including resolving any discrepancies.
Create clear reports that identify consistent trends and propose actionable insights based on available data.
Work closely with management teams to understand their needs and provide appropriate solutions using statistical tools.
Maintain databases by acquiring new data from available sources, ensuring the integrity of the database is not compromised.
Develop protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning datasets.
Collaborate with IT teams to set up secure systems for protecting sensitive company information.



🎯 Your Profile:

You are an ambitious individual who has recently graduated or started your career journey in the field of Data Analysis or related fields. Your ability to analyze large volumes of complex data sets makes you stand out among others. You have excellent attention-to-detail skills along with strong communication abilities that help you explain technical concepts effectively across all levels within the organization.



A degree in Mathematics, Computer Science or Statistics is required; master’s degree is mandatory for a VIE.
Possess knowledge: SQL Server/Oracle/MySQL etc.
Familiarity with statistical software (e.g, SAS) and data visualization tools (e.g, Tableau).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English are essential for this role. Knowledge of Dutch or French would be an added advantage.
Minimum 1 to 3 years of experience.



 🚀 Advantages:



An international learning environment
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.  



💡 We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

  • A degree in Mathematics, Computer Science or Statistics is required; master’s degree is mandatory for a VIE.
  • Possess knowledge: SQL Server/Oracle/MySQL etc.
  • Familiarity with statistical software (e.g, SAS) and data visualization tools (e.g, Tableau).
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English are essential for this role. Knowledge of Dutch or French would be an added advantage.
  • Minimum 1 to 3 years of experience.


 🚀 Advantages:


  • An international learning environment
  • Extensive training and certifications.
  • A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
  • The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
  • Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
  • An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.  


💡 We are an independent company that values:


  • Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
  • International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
  • Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
  • Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.


Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst - Ethics & Business Integrity
Description:
Make your mark for patients

We are looking for a Data Analyst - Ethics & Business Integrity who is analytical, communicative, and self-motivated to join us in our Ethics & Business Integrity (E&BI) team, based in our headquarters office in Brussels, Belgium or in our office in Atlanta, United States.

About The Role

You will be working in a team that designs the compliance monitoring program, including data analysis, research, data management, and reporting, with a goal of enabling the E&BI Team to make informed decisions based on empirical evidence, promoting ethics and business integrity within the organization. Your focus will be on designing data analytics approaches to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of monitoring approaches.

Who You’ll Work With

You will collaborate with various E&BI teams, IT teams, and external partners/vendors to deliver comprehensive data insights and analytics supporting ethical practices and business integrity.

What You’ll Do


Identify opportunities for data-informed reporting and analytics within E&BI.
Assess relevant data sources availability across the organization.
Develop data analytics models to generate insights related to ethics and business integrity.
Deploy and evaluate data analytics solutions and communicate results effectively ….


Interested? For this role we’re looking for the following education, experience and skills


Excellent analytical skills for identifying trends and insights from data.
Experience with compliance monitoring approaches preferred.
Strong knowledge and interest in data (Data Visualization/BI Tools, Coding Languages & Tools).
Effective communication skills, including presentations and clear writing.
Ability to influence stakeholders to maximize the impact of ethics and integrity analytics.
Proven problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.


Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work with us?

At UCB, we don’t just complete tasks, we create value. We aren’t afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‘go beyond’ to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that’s on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on EMEA-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com . Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Description:




As a medior Data Analyst, you have at least 2-5 years of experience in analysing data (such as customer-centric data, reference data, transactional data, accounting data,...) to enable sound decision making :

- You identify and collect data using specific tools or techniques;

- You analyse and extract key data and information;

- You describe functional mapping towards targets;

- You model and define transformation rules to meet the organization's needs and requirements;

- You assist and participate in data validation and cleaning to ensure the quality and integrity of data throughout the whole chain;

- You provide reports that enable the 'business' in their decision making.

Next to a proven experience in data management, you have the following core competences : Agile Methodologies, Analytical thinking, Collaborating, Customer orientation, Data driven.




As a marketing analyst you are responsible for providing data-driven insights into the behavior of our (potential) customers, in order to continuously monitor and optimize the customer journey where necessary




Technical skills:

Adobe Analytics
Adobe Target
Google Analytics




Language skills:

Dutch
English

Title: Senior Data Analyst – Fully Remote
Description:
🚀 Be part of a movement to change the way Europe pays

You will be part of our mission at EPI to build and deliver a meaningful European payment solution.
Together, we want to enable a stronger European payment ecosystem by acting as both bridge and builder, delivering a payment solution for consumers across Europe.

🔎 What's in it for you

Are you passionate about data and eager to make a significant impact on the largest payment initiatives in Europe? We are seeking a talented Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will leverage your analytical skills to drive insights and innovations across various departments and help shape the future of payment solutions across the continent.

💥 Your impact

Dashboard Development:

Design and build interactive and visually compelling dashboards using Tableau.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in all reporting outputs.

Data modelling, analysis & Reporting:

Analyze large sets of data from our events database and other sources.
Translate business knowledge to data models for reporting needs.
Develop, implement, and maintain robust data models.

Data Mining & Insights:

Perform deep-dive analyses to uncover insights and trends within the data.
Use data mining techniques to identify opportunities for improving business processes and decision-making.
Present findings and recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders.

Collaboration & Communication:

Work closely with cross-functional teams including marketing, product, finance, and operations to support their analytics needs.
Provide training and support to end-users on how to leverage dashboards and data insights.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and best practices in data analytics and business intelligence.

💻 Technology stack

Primary: DBT, Databricks, Tableau, AWS Kinesis, Github
Secondary: Terraform, MongoDB, Event-sourcing


🕵🏻‍♀️ To succeed, you should meet at least 70% of these requirements

+6 years of professional experience in data analysis and business intelligence.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Quantitative Economics, Engineering, or a related STEM field; a Master’s degree is a plus.
Expert-level proficiency in Tableau for dashboard creation and data visualization.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL and Python/R.
Excellent problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and their applications in business analytics.
Experience in the payment processing industry.
Experience with collaborative CI/CD using GitHub.
Familiarity with event sourcing data models.

🐝 About the team

You’ll be part of a Pan-European Product and Engineering team that operates in an Agile environment. You’ll work closely — but fully remotely — with experts in Web Dev, Mobile Dev, Backend Dev, QA and DevOps from Germany, France, the Netherlands, Poland, and other European locations.


🪜 If this looks like you, the recruitment steps are:

A first call with one of our recruiters
A Technical interview with our Data Project Lead
A final interview with our Head of Engineering
Hopefully, an offer you can’t refuse



⛔ Turn back if …

You don’t have advanced experience using Tableau for dashboard creation and data visualization.
You don’t have advanced experience in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL and Python/R.

                                                                       Otherwise apply!


€ Who are we?

The European Payments Initiative has a unique role in bringing together the various players in the payment industry. We are creating an innovative, future-proof payment solution designed to meet the needs of merchants, professionals, charities and other organisations that accept payments and to enhance the everyday lives of consumers in Europe.

We believe that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts; EPI acts as a bridge, giving banks and other payment service providers the opportunity to combine innovation efforts and to address shared challenges together. EPI is a catalyst for change, enabling banks, payment service providers, payment gateways and merchants to contribute collectively to the continued strength and resilience of the European Union.

We want to start and grow a new movement with the potential to change the way people across Europe pay in the future.



🫶 Our commitment to equal employment opportunities

EPI offers the same job opportunities to all, without distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability or age. EPI promotes the development of an inclusive work environment that mirrors the diversity of the clients our product is serving.

Title: Analyste de données
Description:
SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.




SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis




Qualifications:

You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
You are fluent in Dutch or French, and fluent in English.




We offer:

A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group




If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
🔵 Capitole is still growing and we want to do it with you! 🚀




We are seeking a talented Data Visualization Specialist to join one of our client. In this role, you will play a crucial part in supporting our internal clients with cutting-edge data visualization and reporting solutions. As we continue to evolve in a landscape of sales performance transformation and digitalization, your expertise will be essential in delivering impactful Tableau dashboards that drive informed decision-making.




🤖 Responsabilities and Requirements:

Collaborate with stakeholders to identify reporting and visualization needs, translating them into Tableau dashboards.
Present and refine dashboards based on stakeholder feedback.
Create, maintain, and optimize dashboards while ensuring alignment with data governance standards.
Focus on automation and work with Data Engineers to build sustainable data structures.
Perform light data prep and advocate for best practices in reporting and data visualization.
Act as a guardian and ambassador for data governance within the team.




🛠️ Technical Requirements:

Strong experience in Tableau dashboard creation and maintenance.
Proficient in SQL for writing and understanding queries.
Familiarity with ETL tools (e.g., SAS Programming, SAS EGP) and DBMS systems (e.g., Oracle, Sybase).
Fluent in French or Dutch, with English fluency required.




🎉 Why Capitole?

🤝 Our employees come first. We believe in a different, more human model, placing people at the center of our company.




📜 Permanent contract or Freelancing
🚗 Company car
🏥 Health Insurance with DKV
🍽️ Meal voucher
🏠💼 Hybrid working: 2 days per week at the office. Brussels




Don't know us yet? Discover us!!




Home - Capitole Consulting







Don't hesitate to send us your profile, we are looking forward to meeting you! ☎📩

Don't know us yet? Discover us!!


Home - Capitole Consulting



Don't hesitate to send us your profile, we are looking forward to meeting you! ☎📩

Title: Job | Data Analyst Technology | Bruxelles
Description:
Description

Vous élevez le reporting stratégique au sein du Corporate Office du CTO à un niveau supérieur.

Grâce à votre data modeling & analytics, votre contrôle strict, votre suivi des KPI et vos dashboards clairs, la direction peut évaluer efficacement les résultats et prendre les bonnes décisions.

Votre job en deux mots

En étroite collaboration avec les directeurs et les équipes du département Technology, vous assurez un flux correct de données, vous développez des rapports globaux, des KPI-dashboards et des analyses pour soutenir les opérations et la stratégie.

De plus, vous pouvez vous développer et élargir vos connaissances en accompagnant les équipes qui utilisent les rapports et les dashboards et en réfléchissant activement à l'optimisation et à la maturité.


Vous discutez avec différentes équipes pour comprendre de quelles informations elles ont besoin et vous effectuez une analyse fonctionnelle.
Vous synthétisez les sources de données et les exigences de reporting dans un data model qui prend en charge les rapports requis.
Vous collectez et analysez des données.
Vous êtes responsable du traitement et du téléchargement des données.
Vous créez des rapports et dashboards BI personnalisés.



Pas besoin d’être un oiseau rare

Chez nous, vous pouvez vous distinguer et révéler le meilleur de vous-même si vous répondez aux critères suivants :


Êtes passionné par la technologie et vous avez envie de mettre en pratique vos connaissances dans le monde de la banque et de l'assurance.
Est titulaire d'un baccalauréat ou d'un master, de préférence en informatique, en ingénierie, en sciences ou dans une direction économique et/ou vous avez déjà une certaine expérience en informatique.
A une bonne dose de curiosité pour les analyses, les chiffres et l'optimisation des processus.
Utilise Excel comme verbe, mais continue toujours en expliquant comment nous pouvons travailler encore plus efficacement en utilisant data analystics/BI.
Possède une connaissance courante du néerlandais ou du français et de l'anglais.



Vous marquez un supplément avec :


De l'expérience en analyse fonctionnelle ou business.
De l'expérience avec les outils BI (PowerBI, Qlik,...).
De l'expérience de la mise à niveau d'Excel vers PowerQuery et/ou PowerBI.



Belfius prend soin de ses talents

Outre la possibilité de faire votre chemin dans un job qui vous plaît, nous vous offrons un contrat à temps plein à durée indéterminée avec :


Un salaire attractif complété par une offre innovante vous octroyant un budget à utiliser selon vos préférences personnelles (p. ex. voiture, vélo, PC, smartphone, tablette, loyer ou crédit hypothécaire sous certaines conditions) et des avantages extralégaux, tels que des chèques-repas, des avantages sur les produits et services internes, une assurance hospitalisation et une assurance groupe.
Des possibilités de développement par le biais d'un large éventail de formations et des opportunités de carrière dans l’ensemble du groupe Belfius.
Un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à des horaires flexibles, à la combinaison du travail au bureau et à domicile et un nombre attractif de jours de congé.
Un lieu de travail moderne au cœur de Bruxelles, avec une salle de sport branchée, un délicieux restaurant sain et des espaces de réunion confortables, le tout à quelques pas de la rue commerciale, de la gare Bruxelles-Nord et de la station métro Rogier.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Leader du crédit à la consommation en Belgique et au Luxembourg, AlphaCredit fait partie du groupe BNP Paribas. De nos bureaux basés en face de la Gare Centrale de Bruxelles, nous proposons un éventail complet de solutions de crédit, par le biais de nos partenaires professionnels ou directement aux particuliers. AlphaCredit continue à se développer. C'est pourquoi nous sommes constamment à la recherche de nouveaux collègues dynamiques et désireux de grandir avec nous.

Pour le service Operations Strategy & Projects, nous sommes à la recherche d’un(e) collègue (m/f)

Business Intelligence Analyst

Votre Fonction:

Au sein de l’équipe ‘Operations Strategy & Projects’ nous sommes à la recherche d’un BI-Analyst passionné par les données et les chiffres.


Au sein des Operations, le BI Analyst s’assure que les différentes business units reçoivent une bonne vue sur le fonctionnement des services a travers la data, et ceci grâce à des Rapports, Dashboard et des analyses de datas
Le BI Analyst s’assure que le management dispose de la data nécessaire de façon à ce qu’ils peuvent prendre les bonnes décisions tactiques et stratégiques
Vous fournissez les rapports récurrents pour nos partenaires des Operations interne et externe
Analyser des données pour éclaircir la vue sur des procès business
Comme BI Analyst vous êtes le point de contact pour toutes les questions BI avec un rapport aux Operations et ceci aussi bien pour les différents départements au sein des Operations que pour la maison mère BNP PARIBAS



Votre Profil :


Vous avez un esprit critique, analytique et logique
Vous avez de l’expérience avec la création des rapports et des Dashboards (via un outil BI comme BO, Cognos, …)
Vous disposez d’excellentes connaissances des applications Microsoft : Word, PowerPoint, Excel & Outlook
Vous parlez couramment le français ainsi que le néerlandais (à l'oral et à l'écrit) et disposez d'une bonne connaissance de l'anglais
Vous êtes précis(e) et organisé(e) dans votre travail
Vous faites preuve d'un réel esprit d'équipe, et travaillez de façon autonome et ciblée
Vous êtes résistant au stress



Notre offre :


Nous vous offrons un emploi passionnant dans une entreprise en pleine expansion.
Nous vous offrons un contrat à durée indéterminée et un salaire compétitif, assorti d'un bonus lié aux performances et d'un large éventail d’avantages extralégaux (assurances, chèques-repas, jours de congé extralégaux,...).
