Title: Graduate Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Graduate Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


A recent graduate with background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

🏠Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

📚Personal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

💰Annual compensation review

🏆Recognition rewards

🏝 Annual holiday leave

👶Parental Leave

🧑‍💼Employee Assistance Programme

🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Data & Analytics (Power BI)
Description:
Job Description

As our new Data & Analytics team member, you will drive the development of global consolidation and corporate performance management processes using Azure, MS-SQL, Tagetik, MDM, and Power BI Fabric technologies.

You also will collaborate closely with business stakeholders, bridging requirements to data modeling.

You will engage with Data Warehouse team throughout specifications, development, validation, and post-development support phases; design and create new datasets and reports in Power BI Online and Excel.

You will finally provide coaching and training to business users across various domains (Sales, Finance, HR, etc.) on Power BI Desktop and internal applications, and support end users in adopting new systems and consolidation workflows.

Responsibilities & Duties

As the new Data & Analytics employee, your responsibilities will turn across different points:

Projects:


You act as primary Power BI stakeholder for system development and enhancements
And collaborate with BI Manager and Business Owner(s) on corporate reporting functionalities
You also conduct technical and integration tests for new applications and programs.


System and Interfaces Support:


You have to manage Power BI Online and MDM for all users (installation, configuration)
Install and validate system updates
And also, document and update system procedures.


Application Support:


You enhance and maintain existing reports and processes
And analyze and implement new functionalities or reports.


Users Support:


You offer guidance, support, and coaching to users
Develop training documentation and conduct user training
And finally assist business owners in validating data and reports.


Your Profile


Bachelor’s Degree preferred, or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience
3+ years of MS-SQL and Power BI (or Equivalent Reporting) experience
Strong grasp of MS-SQL database management (Management Studio, Visual Studio)
Demonstrated experience in hands-on training for application/report users
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure and Data Warehouses environments
Familiarity with SAP (ECC, HCM, and BW)
Proficiency in understanding programming languages: SQL, DAX, and Python
Fluent in English
Limited International travel required
You are a person well organized, reliable, who likes to support the business and building the bridges.


Preferred Experience:


Experience with TimeXtender or equivalent data integration applications
Knowledge of Azure Data Factory and Microsoft Fabric
Knowledge of Standard API Integration workflows
Experience supporting or implementing a Master Data Management system, including data governance, business glossary, and metadata management tools.


The Data & Analytics Team:

The Data & Analytics team has the mission to empower our organization through data driven insights and analytics. In order to do this the team is in the process of building a robust and scalable modern data platform. Besides the current role, the team is composed of BI analysts, data engineers, system architects and business analysts for data governance. Geographically the team is based in the US and Belgium, its responsibilities extend to all parts of the Carmeuse Group globally. Working within our team you will be responsible to further develop and manage our corporate performance management tool used for financial consolidation, budgeting and planning.

You Future Manager

Brian Culp, is the manager and has worked at Carmeuse since July 2020. He brings over a decade of experience in data management and reporting, along with 6+ years of expertise in Power BI. His deep understanding of commercial and industrial operations underscores the importance of consistent and accurate data consolidation. Brian’s leadership style is built on trust, integrity, and support. He is committed to creating a supportive and open atmosphere where individual contributions are valued, and professional growth is a priority. He actively encourages honest input from his team, fostering a collaborative environment that enhances efficiency and performance and ensures reliable and practical solutions for their internal customers.

The Recruitment Process:

As the recruitment process, what do you think of these steps:


Olivia Braszko, our Talent Acquisition Lead will analyze your Résumé and cover letter
A first "Teams" interview will be scheduled with Olivia. You will take 2 personality questionnaires. She will want to know more about you, as a person and as a professional. She will assess your motivations and answer to your questions
You will have a second interview with Brian Culp (our BI Manager) and Aurelie Mordant (our HRBP)
The last interview will take place with John Verkaik (our Group Data Analytics Director).


Why Carmeuse?

We truly believe that where you work matters and, as a family business, we know what makes our employees happy!


Permanent
Flexible working hours
Home working policy
Competitive salary package and benefits
A lot of growing possibilities
A strong HR and training policy to develop your skills
Work life balance.


About Us

READY TO JOIN A ROCK-SOLID FAMILY?

Carmeuse started out as a small family-run business in Belgium.

Today it’s a leading global producer of lime, high calcium limestone and dolomitic stone. Its products are essential to energy producers, environmental services, construction and manufacturing.

With over 90 production facilities spread across almost every continent, and over 4,500 employees working at Carmeuse every day, the company’s most treasured resources are its people.

Carmeuse is dedicated to maintaining a workplace that fosters equal opportunity and creates a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or gender identity. If you require particular assistance with any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you can submit your request by sending an email to hrsupport@carmeuse.com. This option is reserved for people requiring adaptation due to a disability. The information received will be processed by Carmeuse and then directed to a local recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure the proper consideration of the application or hiring process.

The Data & Analytics Team:

The Data & Analytics team has the mission to empower our organization through data driven insights and analytics. In order to do this the team is in the process of building a robust and scalable modern data platform. Besides the current role, the team is composed of BI analysts, data engineers, system architects and business analysts for data governance. Geographically the team is based in the US and Belgium, its responsibilities extend to all parts of the Carmeuse Group globally. Working within our team you will be responsible to further develop and manage our corporate performance management tool used for financial consolidation, budgeting and planning.

You Future Manager

Brian Culp, is the manager and has worked at Carmeuse since July 2020. He brings over a decade of experience in data management and reporting, along with 6+ years of expertise in Power BI. His deep understanding of commercial and industrial operations underscores the importance of consistent and accurate data consolidation. Brian’s leadership style is built on trust, integrity, and support. He is committed to creating a supportive and open atmosphere where individual contributions are valued, and professional growth is a priority. He actively encourages honest input from his team, fostering a collaborative environment that enhances efficiency and performance and ensures reliable and practical solutions for their internal customers.

The Recruitment Process:

As the recruitment process, what do you think of these steps:

  • Olivia Braszko, our Talent Acquisition Lead will analyze your Résumé and cover letter
  • A first "Teams" interview will be scheduled with Olivia. You will take 2 personality questionnaires. She will want to know more about you, as a person and as a professional. She will assess your motivations and answer to your questions
  • You will have a second interview with Brian Culp (our BI Manager) and Aurelie Mordant (our HRBP)
  • The last interview will take place with John Verkaik (our Group Data Analytics Director).

Why Carmeuse?

We truly believe that where you work matters and, as a family business, we know what makes our employees happy!

  • Permanent
  • Flexible working hours
  • Home working policy
  • Competitive salary package and benefits
  • A lot of growing possibilities
  • A strong HR and training policy to develop your skills
  • Work life balance.

About Us

READY TO JOIN A ROCK-SOLID FAMILY?

Carmeuse started out as a small family-run business in Belgium.

Today it’s a leading global producer of lime, high calcium limestone and dolomitic stone. Its products are essential to energy producers, environmental services, construction and manufacturing.

With over 90 production facilities spread across almost every continent, and over 4,500 employees working at Carmeuse every day, the company’s most treasured resources are its people.

Carmeuse is dedicated to maintaining a workplace that fosters equal opportunity and creates a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or gender identity. If you require particular assistance with any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you can submit your request by sending an email to hrsupport@carmeuse.com. This option is reserved for people requiring adaptation due to a disability. The information received will be processed by Carmeuse and then directed to a local recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure the proper consideration of the application or hiring process.

Title: BI analyst - Reporting/ SQL/ Power BI
Description:
NTT DATA is currently looking for BI analyst for a public company in Brussels. This role can be performed hybrid between the office and homeworking.

Role

This role involves curating and analysing data for the client departments of the Business Intelligence team.



The main tasks will be :

Conduct an in-depth analysis of inquiries posed by the business, discerning the core queries requiring attention. Delve into historical questions that could be interconnected with the fresh inquiry
Evaluate existing models to draft a preliminary version of requested models
Formulate queries essential for model construction and subsequently validate their efficacy in addressing the posed questions
Test new queries

The candidate have

A good knowledge in methodology and terminology of dimensional modelling (Kimball)
A good knowledge in PowerBI
Some knowledge in SQL (SQLServer and Oracle)
Some experience with the Microsoft BI suite (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS)

Previous experience in the public sector and/or social security is an important asset.

Language

Dutch, French, English

NTT DATA - a part of NTT Group - is a trusted global innovator of IT and business services headquartered in Tokyo. We help clients transform through consulting, industry solutions, business process services, IT modernization and managed services. NTT DATA enables clients, as well as society, to move confidently into the digital future. We are committed to our clients' long-term success and combine global reach with local client attention to serve them in over 50 countries. NTT DATA has been awarded Top Employer 2024 regional certification in Asia Pacific, Europe, Latin America, and North America including 29 countries. Visit us at nttdata.com

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Voor een stabiele speler actief in de FMCG-sector gelegen in regio Temse zijn we op zoek naar een Data Analyst om het team wegens groei te versterken. Ben jij op zoek naar een gevarieerde functie waar er ruimte is voor eigen initiatief en groei? Lees dan zeker verder!

Jouw takenpakket als Data Analyst:

Je staat in voor periodieke rapporteringen
Je verzamelt en verwerkt diverse gegevens
Je werkt nauw samen met andere afdelingen voor de dataverwerking
Je staat in voor de voorbereiding van onderzoeken
Je staat in voor de ontwikkeling van datamodellen

Het ideale profiel:

Je hebt bij voorkeur een bachelor of masterdiploma of bent gelijkwaardig door ervaring
Je bent een schoolverlater of hebt een eerste ervaring achter de rug
Je bent analytisch heel sterk en kan goed prioriteiten leggen
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en hebt minstens een goede basiskennis Frans
Excel kent geen geheimen voor jou, ervaring met PowerBI is een plus
Je bent flexibel en kan goed omgaan met een snel veranderende werkomgeving

Het aanbod als Data Analyst:

Een gevarieerde functie met mooie verantwoordelijkheden in een sterk en internationaal bedrijf
Veel aandacht voor het individu
Doorgroeimogelijkheden
Mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk
Een plekje in een jong en dynamisch team
Een mooi salarispakket naar ervaring aangevuld met maaltijdcheques, 12 adv-dagen, groeps-en hospitalisatieverzekering,..
Een modern bedrijfsrestaurant waar je elke dag kan genieten van een verse en gezonde lunch

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is seeking a Medior Data Analyst with at least 2-5 years of experience in analysing data (such as customer-centric data, reference data, transactional data, accounting data,...)

To enable sound decision making


You identify and collect data using specific tools or techniques
You analyse and extract key data and information
You describe functional mapping towards targets
You model and define transformation rules to meet the organization's needs and requirements
You assist and participate in data validation and cleaning to ensure the quality and integrity of data throughout the whole chain
You provide reports that enable the 'business' in their decision making


Technical skills


Knowledge and experience with Adobe Analytics
Knowledge and experience with Adobe Target
Knowledge and experience with Google Analytics
Next to a proven experience in data management, you have the following core competences: Agile Methodologies, Analytical thinking, Collaborating, Customer orientation, Data driven

Title: Remote Data Entry Clerks - Immediate Role
Description:
About This Job

Join us as an Online Data Analyst, where you will play a crucial role in managing data collection, analysis, and input for our online systems and social media platforms. This unique opportunity allows you to work full-time remotely and become an integral part of our team.

Join us in making a difference through accurate data management and efficient workflow processes. We look forward to welcoming a dedicated Remote Data Entry Clerk to our team.

Responsibilities


Enter data from source documents into prescribed computer databases, files, and forms accurately and efficiently.
Verify accuracy and completeness of data by reviewing, correcting, deleting, or re-entering data.
Maintain confidentiality regarding sensitive information.
Respond to inquiries regarding data and information.


Requirements


Proven experience as a data entry clerk or similar position.
Fast typing skills; knowledge of touch typing system is preferred.
Excellent knowledge of word processing tools and spreadsheets (MS Office Word, Excel, etc.).
Basic understanding of databases.
Great attention to detail.
High school diploma or equivalent.


Skills


Strong organizational and time-management skills.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Good communication skills.
Adaptability and willingness to learn new tasks.


Privileges


Competitive pay based on experience.
Flexible working hours.
Remote work opportunity.
Potential for growth and advancement within the company.
Show more

  • Potential for growth and advancement within the company.

Title: Internship Business/Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Are you passionate about data and how to manage them?

Are you looking for an internship in data analytics for 6 months?

Are you curious and eager to learn the business side of data management and its impact on the organization? 

At Siemens Belgium we are looking for a driven and creative intern to set up dashboards and small tools to optimize the efficiency of our business unit.

Our division Smart Infrastructure intelligently connects energy systems, buildings, and industries, enhancing the way we live and work to significantly improve efficiency and sustainability.  Within our Digital Building and Infrastructure team, we focus on enhancing building performance of critical infrastructures through the power of data. 

We offer an internship of min. 6 months in our Business Excellence business unit. Our purpose is to improve and innovate data management and processes through Digitalization.

What’s in it for you?


Actively working in and understanding a professional environment.
Collaborating with multiple stakeholders in the company at different hierarchical levels.
Gaining experience in developing different dashboards to support the business and increase transparency and efficiency.
Working on your soft skills, learning to prioritize, and improving efficient communication.
This internship will also help you to develop your critical and constructive sense, your problem-solving ability, and your capacity to adapt and organize yourself. You will be able to put data into perspective to provide a relevant result for end users.
Developing your analytical skills and data management.  


At the end of this internship, you will have achieved:


Produce dashboards.
Co-produce an innovative and time-saving workflows via Power Automate.
Document management in SharePoint.
Co-produce an innovative and time-saving tool is a possibility.


Are you the intern we are looking for?


You are eager to learn Microsoft Office Business Data Analytics (Power Query, Power Pivot, Power BI).
You speak French or Dutch fluently, with a professional knowledge of English.
You are proficient with Excel (mandatory).
You have a first experience with dashboarding (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik Sense) is a strong asset, if not, the willingness to learn them must be present.
Willingness to learn Microsoft 365 power apps: Power Automate
Knowledge of programming languages Python, JavaScript, VBA...is an asset.
Motivation to solve problems, intellectual curiosity for understanding the business (mandatory).
Attention to detail and enjoy autonomy.


Please note that we are looking for someone who can start in October or November. You must also be in possession of a school internship agreement.


Show more

Title: BI & Data Analysis Expert DIGI
Description:
At the forefront of the telecom revolution, our mission is to innovate and lead with a customer-centric, data-driven approach. As we evolve from startup to scale-up, we're enhancing our team with a Data Analyst position to support all domains of our organization from our offices in Brussels (and in some occasions in Oostkamp).

The BI & Data Analysis Expert will be crucial in supporting strategic decision-making & customer behavior through ad-hoc analysis and insights. This role is tailored for a professional skilled in translating complex business questions into data-driven solutions using a variety of internal and external data sources.

Your Key Responsibilities as a BI & Data Analysis Expert will include:


Build a data pipeline to collect data from third party applications into SQL databases.
Utilize Python and SQL to conduct comprehensive data analyses, translating business needs into actionable insights.
Create meaningful visuals to illustrate insights.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand and fulfill their data analysis needs.
Employ advanced analytical techniques to model and predict future trends (e.g. sales, finance & inventory forecasting).
Ensure data integrity and accuracy in all analyses.


Job requirements

Must Haves Qualities & Talents


Ability to cope with uncertainty and to establish foundations in a context of scaling up, demonstrating flexibility and resilience.
Experience using Looker Data Platform (not Looker Studio) is a plus.
Expertise in Python and SQL, with a proven track record in data analysis and visualization.
Strong analytical skills, capable of capturing complex requirements and delivering meaningful insights.
Excellent consulting skills, including stakeholder management, effective communication, and the flexibility to adapt to a rapidly changing environment.
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Business engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field; Master's degree is a plus.
At least 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in telecom, ecommerce, consulting or technology industries.
Proficient in English and in Dutch or French.
Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, critical thinking, and a commitment to providing actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams and articulate complex data concepts in a clear, understandable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience leveraging digital, logistics, geo spatial, sales, marketing, customer care and/or infrastructure data.
Skills in building data driven automation processes (e.g. module processing inputs & outputting predictions/estimations) is a plus.
Data engineering skills is a plus but can be a differentiator.
Specific experience in building Marketing Campaign & customer behavior insights (linking campaign data, Google Analytics, sales & customer care data) is a huge plus.


What We Offer

At Digi Belgium you will be part of an enthusiastic and ambitious team in which we greatly value your own input and believe in the growth of each of our employees. We offer you a great opportunity to work for a fast-growing and innovative employer that operates as a challenger in the Belgian telecom market. Next to this, we also offer a wide range of benefits, including:


Dynamic Work Environment: Dive into the bustling world of telecom at our startup! Expect a workplace that thrives on challenges and growth opportunities.
Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a rewarding package including competitive salary and different interesting benefits
Permanent Contract: Secure your future with us – enjoy the stability of a permanent contract.
Invest in Yourself: We provide ample resources for your personal and professional development. Use our generous budget to level up your skills and become even more awesome.
Contemporary Workspace: Immerse yourself in a cutting-edge office environment where innovation and collaboration reign supreme. Our central locations in Oostkamp and Brussels ensure easy accessibility.
Extra Time Off: Work hard and reap the rewards! Enjoy an extra 12 days off per year for full-time employees, making those 40-hour weeks fly by.


Application Process

Candidates are invited to send their CV along with examples of projects they have worked on by the 6th of September 2024. Be part of our mission to revolutionize the telecom industry, leveraging innovation and data to drive success. The recruitment process will include hands-on business and analytics cases to assess your skills and fit for the role.
Show more

Title: Data Consultant (Analyst & Project Manager) - Financial Services
Description:
Data Consultant (Analyst & Project Manager) - Financial Services (min 1 year of experience)




Square Management Belgium est à la recherche de consultants expérimentés (minimum 1 an) possédant une expérience significative et un intérêt dans le domaine de la data dans le secteur financier (banque et assurance).




🏢 Qui est Square Management Belgium ?

Cabinet de référence dans le secteur financier, nous accompagnons nos clients dans leurs projets de transformation grâce à l’expertise de nos 100 consultants.

Square Management Belgium fait partie du groupe Square Management, un cabinet de conseil européen en stratégie et organisation fondé en 2008, présent en France, en Belgique et au Luxembourg.




💡 Qu’attendons-nous de vous dans notre domaine d’expertise Data

Identifier et hiérarchiser les actifs de données critiques
Élaborer et maintenir des procédures et des politiques de planification, de surveillance et de contrôle des données
Prendre des décisions basées sur les données grâce à des analyses, des visualisations, des quality checks et des data sets
Structurer et exploiter les données de nos clients pour améliorer et renforcer leur activité
Formuler des recommandations et des conclusions

En interne, vous serez impliqué dans la production de contenus d’expertise (articles, publications, podcasts, …), ainsi que dans la participation aux réponses aux appels d’offres et aux initiatives autour de votre communauté.




🔝 Êtes-vous la personne idéale pour ce poste ?

Vous êtes titulaire d'un Master d'une école de commerce, d'une école d'ingénieur ou d'une université
Vous disposez d'au minimum 1 an d'expérience dans un cabinet de conseil, un environnement projet ou dans les services financiers (banque/assurance)
Vous parlez français ou néerlandais (langue maternelle) et parlez couramment l'anglais
Vous possédez des connaissances et des compétences en data analyse et data management
Des expériences en tant que chef de projet, Business/ Functional Analyst et Process Analyst sont un atout majeur.
Vous êtes orientés client, vous comprenez les besoins et les attentes des parties prenantes
Rigoureux dans l'atteinte de vos objectifs, vous possédez de bonnes capacités d'analyse et de communication orale et écrite
Vous êtes proactif, impliqué et vous adaptez rapidement aux nouvelles situations




🎁 Qu’est-ce que Square Management Belgium peut vous offrir ?

Un parcours professionnel en adéquation avec vos ambitions et votre expérience. Vos responsabilités varient selon votre grade (de consultant confirmé à Principal)
Un parcours de formations articulé autour de nos domaines d'excellence : plus de 150 formations certifiantes (méthodologie, métier, langues, développement personnel)
Une excellente opportunité d’évolution personnelle et professionnelle : des missions enrichissantes pour des clients majeurs dans de multiples secteurs (finance, assurance, banque, secteur public, énergie, etc.) ; partager vos connaissances avec vos collègues et impliquez-vous dans un rôle interne qui encourage l'intrapreneuriat et l'intelligence collective autour de la production de contenus (articles, publications, podcast)
Un environnement de travail où l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée, l'ambiance bienveillante et la communication ouverte sont essentiels
Une offre attractive et compétitive : voiture et carte essence, ordinateur, téléphone portable, chèques repas, 13ème mois, programmes de formations, éco-chèques...

Show more

Square Management Belgium est à la recherche de consultants expérimentés (minimum 1 an) possédant une expérience significative et un intérêt dans le domaine de la data dans le secteur financier (banque et assurance).

Square Management Belgium fait partie du groupe Square Management, un cabinet de conseil européen en stratégie et organisation fondé en 2008, présent en France, en Belgique et au Luxembourg.


💡 Qu’attendons-nous de vous dans notre domaine d’expertise Data

  • Identifier et hiérarchiser les actifs de données critiques
  • Élaborer et maintenir des procédures et des politiques de planification, de surveillance et de contrôle des données
  • Prendre des décisions basées sur les données grâce à des analyses, des visualisations, des quality checks et des data sets
  • Structurer et exploiter les données de nos clients pour améliorer et renforcer leur activité
  • Formuler des recommandations et des conclusions

En interne, vous serez impliqué dans la production de contenus d’expertise (articles, publications, podcasts, …), ainsi que dans la participation aux réponses aux appels d’offres et aux initiatives autour de votre communauté.


🔝 Êtes-vous la personne idéale pour ce poste ?

  • Vous êtes titulaire d'un Master d'une école de commerce, d'une école d'ingénieur ou d'une université
  • Vous disposez d'au minimum 1 an d'expérience dans un cabinet de conseil, un environnement projet ou dans les services financiers (banque/assurance)
  • Vous parlez français ou néerlandais (langue maternelle) et parlez couramment l'anglais
  • Vous possédez des connaissances et des compétences en data analyse et data management
  • Des expériences en tant que chef de projet, Business/ Functional Analyst et Process Analyst sont un atout majeur.
  • Vous êtes orientés client, vous comprenez les besoins et les attentes des parties prenantes
  • Rigoureux dans l'atteinte de vos objectifs, vous possédez de bonnes capacités d'analyse et de communication orale et écrite
  • Vous êtes proactif, impliqué et vous adaptez rapidement aux nouvelles situations


🎁 Qu’est-ce que Square Management Belgium peut vous offrir ?

  • Un parcours professionnel en adéquation avec vos ambitions et votre expérience. Vos responsabilités varient selon votre grade (de consultant confirmé à Principal)
  • Un parcours de formations articulé autour de nos domaines d'excellence : plus de 150 formations certifiantes (méthodologie, métier, langues, développement personnel)
  • Une excellente opportunité d’évolution personnelle et professionnelle : des missions enrichissantes pour des clients majeurs dans de multiples secteurs (finance, assurance, banque, secteur public, énergie, etc.) ; partager vos connaissances avec vos collègues et impliquez-vous dans un rôle interne qui encourage l'intrapreneuriat et l'intelligence collective autour de la production de contenus (articles, publications, podcast)
  • Un environnement de travail où l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée, l'ambiance bienveillante et la communication ouverte sont essentiels
  • Une offre attractive et compétitive : voiture et carte essence, ordinateur, téléphone portable, chèques repas, 13ème mois, programmes de formations, éco-chèques...

Title: Business System Analyst
Description:
Kickstart 2025 with a new career opportunity In Brussels!




Location: Brussels




Contract Type: Freelance/B2B or Employee - you decide!




Start Date: Q1 / Q2 2025




Education: Secondary School




Profile: European Passport holder




Business/Systems Analyst (BSA)

Analyses organisation requirements and specifies business, software and system requirements for new ICT solutions.




Nature of the tasks

• Analyse existing systems and business models

• Recommend resolutions and improvements

• Provide integrated solutions

• Provide consolidate findings on components or processes

• Author technical performance requirements

• Ensure security by design

• Maps and documents interfaces between legacy and new systems




Knowledge and skills

• Good knowledge of analysis/modelling tools and techniques (use case diagram, state diagram, entity relationship model, …).

• UML, BPMN 2.0 (Business Modelling).

• Strong capacity in preparing and writing (business) analysis.

• Strong capacity to give high level and technical presentations

Title: Data analist
Description:
Data Advisor Service with an Agile Mindset

Elia Group is moving towards Data-centricity, i.e. Data becomes a masterpiece in its strategy execution, and a Data-driven company. As Data Advisors, within the corporate Digital & Data department, we aim at facilitating and driving the entire organization to leverage data as an enabler to achieve its targets (strategic ambitions, innovation or transformation themes, objectives and regulatory compliance). Our mission consists in facilitating and driving the entire organization to leverage data as an enabler to achieve its targets:


Creating business value through Data
Think Data intuitively
Unlock transversal Data fit for purpose


One of the strategic pillars of the role of a Data Advisor is to close the gap between Business and Data . Together with subject matter experts, you define and design solid foundations for the Data in terms of Metadata, Responsibilities and Discoverability to leverage the Data Platform. The Data Platform.

As part of a product team, the Data Advisor is moving rocks to improve Data Management practices and to ease them. The Data Advisor breathes respect, open-mind, dare, challenge, innovation, customer-oriented and team spirit.

The Data Chapter is looking for a Data Advisor who will work on Data Initiatives at Elia and 50Hertz. It is an opportunity to mark your signature in the corporate Data Management.

What you will be doing


You contribute to improving the Data Governance methodology by providing feedback from the field.
You work with a Business Purpose, while breathing Data, Organization & People, Processes, and Technology.
You understand and analyze the Business needs.
You are looking for solutions that can quickly bring benefits and keep an eye on more-long terms solutions to ensure sustainability on mid-terms.
You leverage advising and training (i.e. Data Owners, Data Stewards, Business and IT teams) by and on-the-job coaching.
You continuously review and ensure transversality of the Business Glossary that defines the common and universal language within Elia, by formalizing the Business definitions of data and their purpose .
You manage expectations from, and intensely collaborate and align with, multi-disciplinary stakeholders, departments and product teams.
You excel at bringing people with various backgrounds together to converge.
You are the ambassador of One Team for the Customer .
You always generate business value.


What You Will NOT Be Doing


You shall not act from an Ivory Tower.
You shall not define Data Governance methodology but will influence its evolution by providing retrospective feedback from the field.
You don’t make decisions for the Business but rather advise them with careful logic or showing your reasoning.
You don’t manage the data community, nor engineering, nor development teams.
You don’t define the details of the solutions architecture, nor the technical architecture, nor will you implement technical solutions.
You don’t develop systems.


Requirements:

Technical Skills (required)

As a candidate for this mission, you can demonstrate proven experience with similar projects, missions or employments, with skills that encompass:


Master knowledge about and have anexperience of min. 4 years with these Data Management activities:
Data Governance – Mandatory
Data Quality Management – Mandatory
Metadata Management – Mandatory
Master Data Management – Mandatory
Data Classification, Data Privacy, Data Security, CIA Measures– Optional
Business Intelligence & Analytics – Optional
Big data – Optional
Data Modeling – Optional
Data Integration & API – Optional
Rapidly understand the Business of Elia as a Transmission System Operator and its underlying concepts. Previous experience related to the Business of “Utilities” or “Energy” and its underlying concepts is an asset .


Soft Skills


Able to challenge your interlocutors by leveraging your rational thinking, and no non-sense philosophy.
Continuously look at data in a transversal way (no siloes), across the entire Enterprise, to prevent non-sense solution.
Track record of driving results through continuous improvement
Customer-oriented
Analytical approach to problem-solving and a track record of driving results through continuous improvement
You are curious, willing to learn and able to introduce creative and innovative solutions
Your communication skills allow you to facilitate workshops where you can act as a leader when necessary as well as coaching people on the job
Adapt your speech according to the maturity level of the other participants, accordingly you are a really good communicator and communicate effectively with team members from different backgrounds (business users, IT project leaders …)
Able to listen, decide, convince and create adoption.
Able to switch easily from a hands-on attitude to a supportive attitude and willing to coach and support Team Members and Data Stewards.
Team player breathing respect, open-mind, dare, challenge, innovation and one team for the Customer
Product-oriented mindset
Language skills: fluent in English AND fluent in at least one of the following languages: Dutch, French or German


Referentie:

CV Uploaden*


verplicht

Title: DATA ANALIST
Description:
Dark Light, een gespecialiseerd staffing agency, is op zoek naar een getalenteerde Data Analist. Met een focus op data engineering, data analytics, data science, master data en data governance, zijn we toegewijd aan het vertalen van data naar bruikbare business inzichten. Onze missie is om bedrijven te helpen groeien door ze in contact te brengen met het beste talent voor hun specifieke behoeften.

Taken


Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het functioneel ontwerpen, structureren en organiseren van de ETL-processen in een datawarehouse.
Je zorgt voor de planning, implementatie en correcte uitvoering van de ETL-flows.
Je ontwerpt, implementeert en onderhoudt on-premise databases om efficiënte opslag, extractie en beheer van ziekenhuisdata te waarborgen.
Je helpt mee om de datakwaliteit te waarborgen en zo de nauwkeurigheid en betrouwbaarheid van de informatie in onze databases te garanderen.
Je werkt nauw samen met het team om onder andere grote datasets te analyseren en modelleren, en zo trends, patronen en inzichten te identificeren die het beleid en de besluitvorming binnen het ziekenhuis ondersteunen.
Je visualiseert complexe scenario's op een duidelijke manier en rapporteert deze aan diverse stakeholders binnen alle lagen van het ziekenhuis.
Je denkt mee over de juiste tools en strategieën die leiden tot efficiënte data-opvraging, rapportage en visualisatie in geavanceerde dashboards.
Je optimaliseert queries om de databaseprestaties te verbeteren en tijdige informatieverzameling te garanderen voor rapportage en analyses.



Vereisten


Je beschikt over relevante werkervaring in databasebeheer, data management en/of data-analyse.
Ervaring in de zorgsector is een pluspunt.
Je kunt data modelleren met tools zoals SQL, Python en R.
Je hebt ervaring met data visualisatietools zoals Tableau, PowerBI, ...
Je bent in staat om mensen te enthousiasmeren, informeren en ondersteunen; je kunt je goed inleven in de behoeften van andere afdelingen en je hebt een sterke drang om samen te werken, wat zeer gewaardeerd wordt.



Benefits


Marktconforme salarispakket
Zeer sterke focus op work-life balance
Talloze trainingsmogelijkheden

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
| Company Overview




TMC is an international high-tech consulting firm that provides expertise to its clients to help them tackle their challenges. For 24 years, with a global presence in 14 countries, we have built a reputation for excellence and reliability through Employeneurship in various fields: Technology & Engineering, Energy & Renewables, Life Sciences & Pharma, and Digital & IT




| Requirements:




Create robust data pipelines using Hadoop, Spark, and NiFi to collect, process, and transform large datasets from various sources.
Implement and manage real-time data streaming solutions using Apache Kafka, ensuring data is processed and available for immediate use.
Write efficient and scalable code in Python, Scala, and Java to support data processing and automation tasks.
Develop and optimize data models, storage solutions, and ETL processes to ensure high performance and scalability.
Work in an Agile environment, collaborating closely with data scientists, analysts, and other engineers to deliver high-quality solutions.




| Why choose the Employeneurship?




Our Employeneurship model is unique, it is a real innovation in the high-tech consulting sector. It is the 21st century working relationship for highly qualified technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars:

You will have a permanent employment contract offering stability and security,
You will learn about your market value and have a share of the benefits generated by your work through individual profit sharing,
We will support you with personalized coaching and a training plan designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills,
Our structure of technical competence cells will provide you with a strong, meaningful and relevant network of experts,
The Entrepreneurial Lab will provide you with a playground to explore new ideas and possibly help launch start-ups.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about harnessing the power of data to drive innovation? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can utilize your IT expertise alongside your data engineering skills?

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Engineer to join our I-care Augmented Intelligence research and development team in Brussels, Belgium. As a key member of our R&D Augmented Intelligence team, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust data pipelines while leveraging cutting-edge technologies for the Industry, namely in the predictive maintenance and reliability sector.

Responsibilities and Activities

Develop and maintain Gitlab CI/CD pipelines to ensure seamless deployment and integration of data pipelines.
Utilize Docker Swarm for containerization, ensuring scalability and efficiency in our data infrastructure.
Implement and manage Airflow workflows for scheduling and monitoring data pipelines.
Utilize MongoDB and SQL for efficient data storage, retrieval, and manipulation.
Harness the power of Google BigQuery for high-performance analytics and data warehousing.
Develop APIs using FastAPI for seamless integration and interaction with various applications.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver tailored solutions.
Demonstrate strong communication skills to effectively convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Requirements

Relevant IT background education, with at least 3 years of experience in Data Engineering.
Proficiency in Gitlab CI/CD pipelines, Docker Swarm, Airflow, MongoDB, SQL, Google BigQuery, and FastAPI.
Experience in MLOps platforms and Kubernetes, Kubeflow, or Celeri is a plus.
Strong problem-solving abilities and a proactive mindset towards overcoming technical challenges.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Adaptability to learn and implement new technologies as per project requirements.

What I-care offers you?

An open and honest environment, where employees are actually valued for their interests, passion, and commitment.
A chance to join the global leader in Predictive and Prescriptive Maintenance.
A dynamic and ever-growing organization where the sky actually is the limit.
An attractive and complete remuneration package according to your competencies and experience, with challenging bonus perspectives.
Your best day at work ever!

Become part of our success story!

I-care, a global leader in predictive and prescriptive maintenance since 2004. With over 800 dedicated technicians and engineers worldwide, we provide quality services and solutions that result in double-digit annual growth. At I-care, we value diversity and believe that everyone can make unique and valuable contributions. Join I-care and make a difference!

Title: Business Intelligence and Data Analytics Engineer
HTML:
Company Description

We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a member of Netcompany Group A/S, and a leading European IT Solutions and Services company with strong international presence and expertise, dedicated to responsible digitalisation. We offer innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of public and private organizations, while being a key-player in the EU Institutions for the past 30 years. We hold an outstanding record of 500+ organizations in 70+ countries, that have chosen our solutions and services, to fulfil their business needs. Our team of 3500+ professionals is our driving force and our most valuable asset.

Job Description

Are you ready to join the forefront of technology as a Business Intelligence and Data Analytics Engineer in Netcompany-Intrasoft?

As a Business Intelligence and Data Analytics Engineer, you will do:

  • Gathering and analysis of the business requirements;
  • Technical analysis and specifications of BI and DA solutions;
  • Exploratory data analysis to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets for diagnosis and prediction;
  • Definition and drafting of training and support procedures;
  • Architecture, design, deployment, and management of Data Platforms;
  • Design, modelling, development, management and review of end-to-end BI and DA products based on on-prem and cloud data platforms;
  • Including: ETL, Data Lakes, Data Warehouse, visualizations for non-specialist (eg: reports, charts, and dashboards), export mechanism (eg: APIs);
  • Set-up CI/CD pipelines including automatic testing and quality assurance;
  • Maintenance of BI and DA products, including troubleshooting, bug fixing, performance analysis, technical migrations;
  • Integration and reusability of COTS, SaaS, PaaS and SaaS;
  • Conception and implementation of data protection measures, data security measures and disclosure control;
  • Definition of test strategies, design, and testing;
  • Definition of best practices and standards;
  • Technology watch, technology evaluation and contribution to platform definition and strategy documents;


Qualifications

What would make you a fit for the role:

  • In depth knowledge of modern data platforms architecture, including integration of different products/technologies to deliver data-driven solutions;
  • In dept knowledge of data modelling for data lakes and data warehouses (eg: Medallion Architecture, Star Schema and Kimball);
  • In depth knowledge of SQL (eg: Oracle, SQL Server,…);
  • In depth knowledge of orchestration (eg: Airflow) and ETL tools (eg: DBT, SSIS,);
  • In depth knowledge of visualization tools (eg: PowerBI);
  • In depth knowledge of CI/CD tools, testing and quality assurance;
  • Excellent analytical thinking, by using logic and reasoning to identify patterns and gaps while analyzing and exploring data;
  • In depth knowledge of programming languages for data analytics (eg: python, R, …);
  • Experience in setting up a Centre of Competence to provide advice, support and training for Business Intelligence and Data Analytics related activities for technical and non-technical users;
  • Technical guidance including solution finding for highly complicated issues;
  • Validation of technological orientations;
  • Validation of business cases and/or maturity assessment studies;
  • Ability to cope with fast changing technologies;


It would also be a plus if you match some of the following:

  • Experience in real time reporting would be an asset;
  • Experience in linked open data and semantic technologies, ontologies, metadata standards, reference databases, multilingual thesauri and taxonomies would be an asset;
  • Experience in big data, geospatial data, unstructured information, automated document classification and reference databases would be an asset;
  • Experience in cloud environments and containerization would be an asset.


Additional Information

Being a part of the Netcompany-Ιntrasoft team, you will be provided with:

  • The opportunity to work in a modern environment.
  • A competitive compensation & benefits package
  • Hospitalization plan
  • Hybrid working model
  • Meal and commuting allowance
  • Well-being activities (on premises)
  • Continuous learning opportunities using the most modern methods (unlimited access to Udemy for Business, ad-hoc trainings)
  • A personalized development plan for targeted career growth


If you are looking forward to be part of a diverse environment, and have the opportunity to work alongside well-experienced professionals, on challenging, large-scale projects that directly impact millions of citizens around the globe, then this is the place to be!

By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft Belgium, you will be an integral part of a distinguished team of 600+ tech enthusiasts working for international projects, primarily within the European Institutions market. Whether you're collaborating with clients on their premises or harnessing the power of cutting-edge technologies at our own facilities, you'll have the opportunity to shape the future of digital services in an environment that values your ideas and fosters your growth.

Our culture

Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU

#BePartOfSomethingGreat!

  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Permanent position only




What is Cream all about?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company specialized in IT development and Business improvement. We are active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




Cream’s special recipe:

- 1/3 of Personal development

- 1/3 of Collective Intelligence

- 1/3 of Intrapreneurship




And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




What is a Data Engineer at Cream?

As a Data Engineer at Cream, you can be in charge of the implementation of BI Business Projects or potentially coaching junior data engineers. As well, be responsible for the development of data ingestion and analytics solutions (data warehouses, data marts, etc.)




Your tasks :

Architecting Data Systems: Designing robust and scalable data models to meet business needs.
ETL Development: Creating or improving efficient Extract, Transform, Load processes to integrate and process data.
Performance Optimization: Monitoring and fine-tuning data pipelines and databases foR optimal speed and efficiency.
Data Security Implementation: Establishing data security measures to protect sensitive information and ensure compliance.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Working closely with data scientists, analysts, and other teams to understand data requirements and provide technical solutions.




How do we imagine our future consultant?

You have at least 2 years experience in data engineering
You have a Master’s degree, preferably in IT (Computer or industrial engineering) or in Business Administration or equivalent by experience (more than 5 years).
You are used to working with different data tools such as SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, AWS, Azure data factory, Apache Spark, SQL, Python, Tableau
You have a good database knowledge (SQL and NoSQL)
You are fluent in French or Dutch and have full professional capacity in English
You know what it means to work in an Agile mode
You are passionate about data, pay attention to details and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business




Why should you taste the lime flavor?

· A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box

· You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues

· You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology

· You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company

· We have values we share, live with, experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE, CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Mission

Within the Digital Connected Company & Innovation we focus on helping our clients unlock the value within data. In order to support our unit, we are looking for Big Data / Analytics/ AI consultants who are able to implement an End-2-End data platform.

A data platform designed and driven by business value, is able to ingest data in a proper way, can manage the data quality, can store data securely and offers possibilities for integration with client-specific platforms.

As a Data & Analytics Consultant you have experience with multiple aspects of data: from (master)data management, over big data, data lakes, data visualization to data science and machine learning. You can use data in both a traditional data context (dashboard and reports), but also use it within the modern era of big data solutions, artificial intelligence and advanced analytics.

You have experience in one or more of these domains:


You are able to listen to business people, understand their challenge and shape a data solution that brings value.
Set up data platforms and the data management (the data model, integration, authorization), with all the components needed to support the data strategy of the customer (AI capabilities, Visualization, MDM,..)
Build data science or machine learning solutions that will bring business value. Build and optimize the best possible algorithm but also a webservice or application that can be used in an operational environment
Visualize the data on the best possible way: from a cooperate dashboards, an interactive report to a full self-service environment
Set up processes and governance that will be enabler for a data-driven culture (data stewardship, golden record, data lineage,..)


Profile


You obtained a master’s degree in applied statistics, computer science, engineering or similar by experience
You are passionate about data and analytics technology and trends
Have at least 3 years’ experience in implementing data solution and analytics
You are fluent in Python or R
Have knowledge about data architecture, data integration, big data, data lakes, data visualization, computer vision, natural language processing, machine learning
You have experience with different data consumption techniques from traditional to more advanced analytics and AI perspective. (Power BI, Tableau, PyTorch, TensorFlow…)
Or you have hands-on experience with data platforms (e.g Azure, AWS, Google, Databricks, Boomi, Collibra, snowflake…) and are not afraid to dive into something you don’t know.
Have at least 1 year experience with Relational database technology
Have at least 1 year experience with NoSQL database technology
You have a good understanding of clustering, predictive modeling techniques and recommender systems
You have a pro-active, can-do mindset
You communicate clearly in Dutch and/or French and English (both written and spoken).


You get bonus points if:


You can present and defend your solutions in front of clients
You are able to organize, facilitate and lead workshops


Discover Your Future with Inetum Belgium


Make a Difference with a Meaningful Career: step into a role where your work truly matters. At Inetum Belgium, you’ll have the chance to impact lives and drive meaningful change every day.
Grow and Evolve Professionally: embrace a culture of continuous learning and development. We offer a range of training opportunities designed to help you expand your skills and advance your career.
Unlock Relevant Career Opportunities: pursue the career path you’ve always dreamed of with tailored opportunities and the IT expertise you need to succeed.
Achieve Work-Life Balance: we value your well-being. Enjoy flexible working hours, the convenience of satellite offices, the comfort of home working, and an informal, no-nonsense environment.
Enjoy Generous Annual Leave: life is more than just work. Take advantage of 32 days of annual leave to relax and recharge.
Travel in Comfort: forget the hassle of commuting. We provide a company car and a national fuel/charging card to keep you on the move. Prefer a different option? You can choose a mobility allowance instead.
Comprehensive Insurance Coverage: your health and security are our priorities. Benefit from group insurance and hospitalization insurance that show we care.
Attractive Compensation Package: we offer a competitive gross salary to recognize and appreciate your hard work.


Organization

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Every day, the Group's 28,000 consultants and specialists aim to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector bodies and society as a whole: solutions that contribute to performance, innovation and the common good.

Present in 19 countries, close to the regions, and with its major software publisher partners, Inetum meets the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition to grow and industrialize, Inetum generated sales of €2.5 billion in 2023.

In response to a market that has been growing steadily for over 30 years, Inetum has made the deliberate choice to refocus on 4 core businesses in order to gain strength and offer customized solutions tailored to the specific needs of its customers: consulting (Inetum Consulting), infrastructure and application management (Inetum Technologies), software implementation (Inetum Solutions) and its own software publishing business (Inetum Software). Inetum has forged strategic partnerships with 4 of the world's leading software publishers - Salesforce, ServiceNow, Microsoft and SAP - and is pursuing a dedicated acquisition strategy to become one of Europe's top 5 in these technologies, and offer the best expertise to its customers.

At Inetum Belgium, we offer more than just a job; we provide an inspiring environment and opportunities for growth and development. We strive to create a workplace where you can harness your talents, contribute to challenging projects, and be part of a leading IT consultancy group.

Title: Young Graduate Business Analyst - Data & Analytics Team
Description:
Working on innovative solutions to address emerging business challenges, you will have the opportunity to make a difference in genuine partnership with market-leading clients, impacting the way people work and live in the future.




We are offering you an interesting and challenging position as




A Young Graduate Business Analyst




Main responsibilities:




Collaborate on the design and implementation of effective data management frameworks.
Work closely with market-leading clients to understand their unique data governance needs.
Assist in developing and executing comprehensive data governance solutions.
Contribute to the development and optimization of data models, structures, and workflows.
Implement and operate data governance tools, ensuring their efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver customer-focused outcomes.
Demonstrate strong analytical and programming skills when needed.




Ideal profile:




Recent MSc or MA graduate in Computer Science, Information Management, Business Engineering, or a related field.
Proficient in English, with a good command in French and/or Dutch.
Keen interest and basic knowledge in data management and data governance.
Familiarity with data models, structures, and workflows.
Exposure to at least one data governance tool is advantageous.
Proactive mindset and entrepreneurial spirit.
Effective communication and presentation skills.
Team player with a customer-success-oriented approach.
Programming skills are considered a plus.

BearingPoint offers you:




An enriching career within a leading European Business Consulting firm with a people-centric approach.
The possibility to work on several international projects within an easy-going team.
Cross-level collaborations with our data experts, eager to share their knowledge.
Excellent growth opportunities while having access to high-quality trainings and tailor-made coaching.
An individual support from a Development Manager.
An attractive salary package (mobile phone and laptop, company car with international energy card or a mobility budget allowance, meal vouchers, hospitalization coverage and group insurance, performance-related bonus).

Apply and become part of a quality-driven practice excelling in Data Governance!

Title: Electro-optical data analyst/Measurement campaign coordinator
Description:
APPLICATION BY EMAIL according to the application rules hereunder (not via LinkedIn). Please attach all the documents asked.




In the framework of the study “Hyperspectral Imaging Platform for the European Defence” (ref: HYPER-IP), we are looking for a full-time researcher with :

a Master degree (or PhD) in Science or a Master degree (or PhD) in Engineering Science,
a background in (infrared) image processing or imaging spectroscopy
experience in setting up field measurements with electro-optical sensors.

The Royal Military Academy values diversity and equal opportunities. We enthusiastically welcome applications from all individuals, regardless of gender, origin, or other personal characteristics. Whether you are a man, a woman or X, or come from any background, we firmly believe that diversity enriches our community, and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply.




Context

The Royal Military Academy of Belgium (RMA) is a military institution responsible for the basic academic, military and physical training of future officers, and for the continuing advanced training of officers during their active career in the Belgian Defense department (www.rma.ac.be). It is fully recognized as a university, fulfilling the same criteria as civilian universities.

The RMA is also conducting scientific research at university level for projects funded by the Belgian Defense department or external sources.




Study

For this project you will work within the Department of Mathematics (MWMW) of the Faculty of Applied Sciences.

You conduct scientific research at university level on a project titled ‘Hyperspectral Imaging Platform for the European Defence’. You work within a research team and in close collaboration with the different components of the Belgian Armed Forces, as well as national and international industrial and military partners, with the aim of defining operational requirements, setting up measurement campaigns and processing of the data acquired during these measurement campaigns. A high level of autonomy is required.

The project aims to overcome some of the current technological gaps of hyperspectral technologies in the defence sector by developing a technological demonstrator for space and airborne remote sensing applications. Hyperspectral sensors in SWIR bands show a significant added value in applications like (camouflaged) target detection, surface contaminants identification and target signatures characterization with respect to VIS bands. Moreover, the SWIR band is of interest for its operational capability in a degraded visual environment.

Recently, SWIR hyperspectral imaging systems have made significant progress in terms of weight, size, cost, and performance, thanks to progress in third-generation intrinsic detectors, cryogenic cooling, and cost-effective fabrication techniques. The HYPER-IP project will progress the state of the art by developing an advanced miniaturized and militarized SWaP-C (Small Size, Weight, Power and Cost) demonstrator to achieve high performance in terms of signal to noise ratio and frame rate. The demonstrator will be integrated with a processing tool to enable real time understanding of the data. The final goal is to develop a hyperspectral system (imager and real time processor) to be used on small spaceborne platforms.




Main Tasks

Perform research activities in the frame of the study project:

Analyze the operational needs in selected scenarios
Meet with national and international partners to discuss requirements and outcomes. (Regular travel is part of the job.)
Organize measurement campaigns/field trials to validate the results.
Capture and process hyperspectral data for further exploitation by other researchers.

Secondary Tasks

Assist with the administrative aspects of purchases
Assist with the dissemination of the results of this study during PR events, at international conferences and in scientific journals
Assist other researchers with your knowledge, including writing of new proposals in the field of Hyperspectral Imaging.




Required skills

Technical skills

The applicant shall have a Master’s degree (or PhD) in Science or in Engineering Sciences.

Your publications in peer reviewed journals in one of these domains should be added to your application.

“MUST HAVE” skills:

Experience with capturing electro-optical data during laboratory or field trials
Experience with processing electro-optical data
Proficiency in writing scientific and technical documents in English

“HIGHLY RECOMMENDED” skills:

Training or experience in hyperspectral and spectroscopy techniques and their applications
Training or experience in sensor modeling.

Other skills

The applicant shall have very good knowledge of English (oral / written).
The applicant shall preferably have knowledge of either French or Dutch and a minimum knowledge of the other language in order to allow collaboration with peers. This will be tested during the selection process.

Specific requirement

The researcher will be exposed to classified information and will therefore have to obtain the required security clearance. The candidate must consent with the background check required to obtain this clearance, which will be executed by the Belgian Defence.
Only applicants with a nationality of a country that is both part of NATO and the EU will be eligible.
A driver’s license valid in Belgium is an added value.
Working for the Patrimony requires living in Belgium for the duration of the study.




Application

You will be working in a military environment. That is why everyone is expected to undergo a security verification. A passport issued by a country that is both member of the EU and NATO is required. Please add to your application the filled-out document. The form can be downloaded from:

http://www.rma.ac.be/nl/aanvraag-veiligheidsverificatie (Dutch) or

https://rma.ac.be/sites/default/files/2021-03/Demande%20d%27Avis%20de%20S%C3%A9curit%C3%A9_F.pdf (French).

There is unfortunately no English version of this document.

Please send your complete application by e-mail. Incomplete applications will not be considered. We do not accept applications via LinkedIn. Send ALL of the following elements to Prof Dr ir Rob HAELTERMAN (rob.haelterman@mil.be), and Dr ir Helena BRUYNINCKX (erm-deao-rswo@mil.be):

A CV and a motivational letter
a scan of your ID card (both sides);
the filled-out security document (Please do not forget to sign & add the denomination “GELEZEN EN GOEDGEKEURD” (Dutch) or “LU ET APPROUVE” (French))
your relevant publications (a link to an online open access repository is acceptable)

Please mention clearly the reference of the project in the subject line of your mail: “HYPER-IP”.

(Mails received without this reference or applications sent other than by email to all the above addresses will not be considered. Applications that do not contain all the above elements will also not be considered.)

Application deadline: August 31st 2024

The interviews will take place at the Royal Military Academy, Hobbemastraat 8, 1000 Brussels. In specific cases, on-line interviews can take place. The date and time of the interview will be communicated to the preselected candidates.




Contract

Date of selection: September 26th 2024
Start of contract: December 2nd 2024.
This contract depends on the signature of the contract with EDA. This is currently ongoing, but should be finalized before the end of August 2024. This means that the job offer is currently provisional until that date.
Status: Full-time employment (38 hours / week) based on an open-ended contract with the Patrimony of the Royal Military Academy (you will not be a civil servant).
To be very clear: your contract will be open-ended, but the financing of the contract will be tied to a project that ends on April 1st 2027. The financing of your contract beyond that period is therefore not 100% guaranteed. However, the chance that we will be able to offer a follow-up project beyond that date is high.
Wage scale: class A1 (holder of a Master's Degree in Science); class A2 (holder of an Ir degree or equivalent Master's degree in Engineering Sciences, doctor’s degree in the same area of expertise). RMA-Patrimony applies a merit-based research career track, allowing researchers to advance in wage scale based upon annual evaluations.
Holiday pay.

Extra-legal benefits

Possibility to benefit from a bilingualism allowance (Dutch/French) following a SELOR test;
End-of-year bonus;
Free DKV hospitalization insurance. Possibility of additional affiliation for one or more persons living under the same roof: spouse, child(ren) (50% of the price per additional member);
Bike allowance / Free public transport (home-work commute);
Free access to campus sports facilities outside working hours;
On-campus restaurant and cafeteria with democratic prices (discount on the daily menu);
Meal vouchers (6€/day)
Flexible working hours within the 38-hour week + Teleworking possible with allowance;
Holidays o 29 days holiday / year from the 1st year of contract (then from 45 years: +1 day holiday every 5 years) o + 1 week OFF every year between Christmas and New year’s Eve
Advantages and interesting offers thanks to the Benefits@work card (discounts, vouchers...);
Entitlement to services offered by the ‘Office Central d'Action Sociale et Culturelle de la Défense’ (OCASC): among others holiday centres, discount on travel organised by the tour operator...;
Possibility of benefiting from the nursery funded by Belgian Defence (subject to availability).




Workplace

Royal Military Academy, Avenue de la Renaissance 30, 1000 Brussels;
Occasional travels abroad for scientific conferences, etc.

Points of contact

Concerning the research project: to Prof Dr ir Rob HAELTERMAN (rob.haelterman@mil.be )
Concerning the recruitment modalities: Dr ir Helena Bruyninckx (erm-deao-rswo@mil.be)
For more information about the Royal Military Academy, see http://www.rma.ac.be
Show more
